Name: Lee Mendham
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2020
Review Content: I haven't given any stars for Alexa integration, for the simple reason that I haven't used it. Can't be bothered with all this newfangled voice control stuff. That's why I went with the Lite version in the first place - why pay for a bunch of bells and whistles I'm not going to use?As for the rest, though, I have no complaints. It was very simple and straightforward to set up and use. The stick is designed to plug into a spare HDMI port on the TV, but wouldn't fit due to a plug in the adjacent port. Fortunately they've allowed for this eventuality by including a short HDMI extension lead, and that did the trick.After that, all I had to do was follow the on-screen instructions to link it to my wi-fi and then my streaming accounts. That was slightly time-consuming due to having to enter all the various passwords and authorization codes, but once it's done it's done and I can watch to my heart's content.The picture quality's fine and I've had no problems. Watching Netflix and Amazon Prime shows via the Fire stick is an improvement from watching via Virgin, because there's no frame-rate incompatibility, so no motion judder.If a programme is left in pause for too long the screen will revert to a photo slideshow, but pressing the "U-turn" button will take you back to the Resume option.As for the remote, it's much smaller and lighter than those for my TV, Blu-ray, etc., but the controls are simple and intuitive. My only minor quibble is that using the up/down/left/right buttons to search through menus can make my finger a bit sore (and yes, that wouldn't happen with Alexa, but then my throat might get sore!)Given its small size and cheapness this gadget punches way above its weight and I have no hesitation in recommending it. (And yes, iPlayer and BritBox are indeed available!)

Name: Lilah Ivy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 September 2020
Review Content: Easy set up. Works perfectly. I already have a smart tv but wanted this for some extra apps and things that weren't available on my smart tv's interface. I can control my tv volume and on/off function with my echo as before, I can change channels or apps using both the firestick voice remote or my echo, and I can also control the firestick with my tv remote. So even if my kids manage to lose one or even both remotes I still have full control over all functions.

Name: Linzilou

Review Content: The device significantly falls short of the advertised description of simply plug and play and simple to set up and use. Numerous attempts were made with a superfast broadband connection carefully following all instructions and the device will not go beyond unable to update even after following online support and including factory resets. This device seems to have defective, un useable software.

Name: Reynolds
Review Title: Junk your old Fire TV stick in favour of this
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 October 2020
Review Content: I’ve been struggling on with an original Fire TV stick for a while. Increasingly, it been getting slower to navigate, freezes and keeps buffering even though my phone shows a download speed of 55mbps over wi-fi in the same room.This new version, despite it being entry level, is amazing in comparison. No more 5 second lag when pressing the buttons or freeze frames during content viewing. The experience is just as it should be. It even automatically connected to my account and wi-fi when I first turned it on.

Name: MsSteeple
Review Title: Not as good as my old Fire box and the revised design of the remote is dreadful
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 December 2020
Review Content: I only bought this because I couldn't load Britbox on my older version of Amazon Fire and it is definitely not as good. As others have noted, the handset is almost impossible to get into, so utterly unfit for anyone who may be less-abled or elderly - the old version of the handset was easy to open and I now dread changing the batteries. My other big gripe is that when I leave the firestick on standby it often loses the sound so I keep having to unplug and re-plug it in to get the sound back, which is extremely annoying. I much preferred my old model which never gave me any problems. Please test new versions thoroughly in future before rolling them out to check they can be used easily by all of your customers and that they work as they should! Thanks,

Name: S. Lovell
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 November 2020
Review Content: I've been vaguely planning to replace our aging YouView box for a while, and when I saw an offer on the Fire TV Stick, I thought I'd give it a go. I was a little nervous that it might be underpowered (it's very small) and that the using Wifi rather than a network cable might result in poor performance too.I needn't have worried. Where our YouView box had often seemed slow and unresponsive the FireStick is snappy, and the modern interface makes browsing the available options a breeze. There is support for all the major "on demand" players (including Plex, which is another win for me). I haven't noticed any significant lag related to using Wifi either (though our router and the FireStick are less than a metre apart).The only downside compared to the YouView box is the inability to record and/or pause normal TV, but that was a feature we very rarely used ... and for catch up TV is redundant unless you're wanting to build a collection rather than simply watch once.So, the YouView box has now been unplugged and I'm not looking back!

Name: fanny aggs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 October 2020
Review Content: Just received 2 Amazon lite firesticks  to replace my ageing 1gen sticks there seems to be a problem an inbuilt virusin them there produce broken icons for side loaded apps on the start up page, I have been on utube and many  lite firestick have this problem only when Amazon puts an update out to resolve this problem i will be sending them back, Come on Amazon play fair with your loyal customers Reg

Name: Mr. C Bell
Review Title: Good streaming stick, but 3 stars because Amazon force increasing amounts of advertising onto you
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: As a streaming stick works fine: easy to set up and use, good performance, good range of apps.However...Be warned that Amazon treat this as a compulsory advertising vehicle, with its user interface prioritising what they want to push onto you as opposed to what you want to receive.  Their latest update (20/12/2020) makes this even worse by allocating even more space and priority to this with, so far as I can see, no mechanism for removing banner ads and "sponsored content" (ie rubbish no sane person would ever want) short of hacking the operating system.Given that this is something which you pay for I find such behaviour unacceptable.

Name: G. R. Wilkinson
Review Title: Rule 1 - Switch off at the wall, then back on again
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2021
Review Content: It is well worth remembering Rule 1 ... Because that's the one you will use the most .  There are not as many FREE to watch films / programmes as you would imagine. The concept of the Fire stick is amazing .. and if you speak without a regional accent in perfect queens English the voice remote will work great.  My first fire stick lasted around 5 or 6 months then stopped working, the online support is very good (I suppose it is so often used that it has to be) They soon discovered mine was faulty so offered me a FOC exchange which lasted a further 8 month (just beyond its warranty strange that isn't it) ... So I bought a new one so we were able to complete the watching of a series we had gotten in to ... So its new , it no longer controls the volume etc but its ok.  But enjoy it while it lasts because once you switch it off , the very next ,in fact practically every time you switch it on it will tell you it has lost Network connection and you will need to revert to Rule 1 ... Switch it off at the wall then back on again... The Firestick has been around long enough now to have ironed out its teething problems , but that would mean that you would not need to BUY a replacement from Amazon ... its a win win Product for Amazon and hours of frustration for the user . Would I ever buy another one ... yes of course I will in 13 months time just after my warranty expires .

Name: Mike P
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2020
Review Content: I purchased this for use with my Viewsonic M1+ Projector. Set it up on the tv first (downloaded Netflix, iPlayer, Prime Video, etc) and signed in to various accounts - very easy to do, you can use a browser on your phone. Streams everything perfectly, inc Netflix. Comes with a standard plug and USB cable but my projector is portable, so tried plugging a short micro USB to USB cable into the USB 1 socket (5v, 1 amp output). Works perfectly - this firetv stick needs 5V, 900 milliampes. So now portable - will be able to watch Netflix outside on our 100” screen! Wondering if I can connect to G4 signal off the phone if away from wi-fi: if yes, will update this review.Only 1080p but that is sufficient for this projector. Very clear picture, no stutter on sound (in stereo) and, by utilising the USB cable, totally portable. Please note - the USB cable didn’t work when plugged into my tv but that may be a setting issue, also the tv is about 6 years old. I would think most modern TVs output the nescessary power from a USB socket, which means one less plug hole needed!Very pleased - especially at a cost of £19.99 in BF sale....

Name: Pydar
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 November 2020
Review Content: I found the Fire stick fairly easy to install, except for the Alexa voice control remote.  This still has not worked and I feel I don't have enough time to go into it all again.  The remote worked at first except for the voice control.  Having had to unplug it from the mains at one point, I then found I had to re-install it from the start with passwords etc.  At that point, I gave up on the remote through lack of time but will get back to it later having looked at all the instructions online.  Excellent picture though and I can use it with the TV's own remote for the time being.

Review Content: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 November 2020

Name: TOxfordshire
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 October 2020
Review Content: Bought this to temporarily replace my Apple TV box. Whilst a big price difference differentiates the two products, I have been disappointed by the clunky controls when compared to Apple, the lack of apps (Apple has Now TV in addition to the ones I have on Amazon).There have been several glitches when the Fire Stick hasn’t responded and allowed me to go to the Home Screen, stating a network issue, this has resulted in a hard rest of the device (unplugging it), this despite the Echo Dot sat next to the TV still being connected to the internet along with my other devices too.I have also been disappointed by the adverts on the Home Screen, not helped with the clunky controls I have selected adverts when I have wanted apps and content.So for £29, this isn’t bad, just manage your expectations if you have used other superior products like Apple and Apple TV. Plus save £10 and dont buy the £39 version as most TV controls can work the device and the on off / volume buttons too (Sony Bravia here). And if they can’t, is it too much of a hassle to have two remotes?

Name: AL
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: Runs smoother and quicker than older models but not happy with the fact it does not go into standby very well. What I mean by that is, when I turn the TV off for the night and come back to it the next day, the fire stick often won't come back on. I get either a blue screen with "no signal", a plan black screen as if it is sleeping but won't come back on or once I got a screen full of "static". I have to unplug the power cable for a min and start again which can be a pain with it stuck behind the TV.Also, while the remote looks almost identical, the rear door for the battery is a different design which feels very flimsy, doesn't fit so well and has some sharp edges.If I had paid more for it, I might return it but after picking up at a reduced price it doesn't seem worth it.

Name: Hilary Weinstein
Review Title: Brilliant Addition to the Device Family
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 October 2020
Review Content: When son took away the PS4 we were devastated as we would not be able to watch Prime or Netflix anymore.  He told us to buy a Fire Stick.  We did without knowing anything about it!  Best buy ever.  Not too pricey, easy to install and works like a dream.  Highly recommend for those of us with older TVs that don't have automatic access to Iplayer, Netflix and lots of other great choices.

Name: Gonk
Review Title: Handy HD streamer, but limited functionality.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 November 2020
Review Content: Handy HDMI streaming device for use with an HD TV, but could not get it working with my VGA monitor, also found it had poor echo cinema sound quality via WiFi.Using with an old PC monitor I found it wouldn’t remember the 720p VGA video resolution & defaulted back to 1080p when I switched off the monitor. The auto video resolution feature didn’t seem to work properly with VGA. I used to have no problem with my old 1st Gen Fire TV Stick. In the end I had to swap out my old Dell monitor for a Samsung 24” HD TV which works fine.Also the WiFi bandwidth on this model seems to be limited compared to the 4K version, the picture is fine with 1080p movies but the cinema sound via WiFi was very low bit rate and terrible quality (even right next to the WiFi router on 5GHz) So I would recommend either the 4K Fire TV Stick, or use the Amazon Fire TV Ethernet Adapter if you wish to setup cinema sound with an echo device.

Name: davold

Review Content: It was on special offer and our old one was starting to play up(probably programmed to do so), so I thought great. When you turn the TV  off it will not(the fire stick)turn on again unless you get up unplug it from the power wait 10 seconds then plug it back in again. Review Content: Less than two weeks after purchase the remote and fire stick stopped communicating. Name: Raymond Webb
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020
Review Content: The fire stick is easy to install just plug in to the television via an HDMI lead and plug into the mains. The fire stick will update its software to ensure it is fully up to date. You then can add various apps to the stick by following the on screen instructions. You will need a tablet or computer to verify your accounts but other than that it is quite easy to set up. Most apps are available for free but some will need a pay to view.The picture is very good although on some apps it does have slight reduction to in quality. Overall I would recommend it as it gives you a great range variety of things to watch and the Alexa voice control is a useful tool to have although you will need to lean how to use it correctly.

Name: JPK
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 September 2020
Review Content: Iplayer and ITV hub now available.Bought this to use in my motorhome and have found that it's a big improvement on previous models. Works well with a very limited Wifi signal and so far has not had any of the pauses that I got with my older firetv 4k stick. Simple and intuitive interface.

Name: Helen
Review Title: Couldn't use straight out the box so ended up costing more
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 March 2021
Review Content: I switched from Apple TV (1st gen) to Amazon Fire Stick as there were new apps, such as BritBox and Disney+, that we couldn't get on Apple TV unless we did AirPlay, which was a bit of a faff (and kept dropping whenever we paused). Only 4th gen Apple TV allows you to add apps, which was £150, so this seemed a cheaper alternative.However, it wasn't as cheap as I thought! For a start, we needed to buy a longer USB cable, as we use a projector (not a TV) which was too far away from the plug, so for the sake of an extra 10cm, we needed to pay £10 for another cable. Then, to my horror, I found the Amazon Fire Stick has no audio outlet! I guess this is fine if you are using with a TV, but with a projector, you'll need to buy an HDMI Audio splitter, which was another £20.Once we did get it working (now with loads of cables - ugh) the menu screen is horrible, and it takes several clicks to get to what would be a much more sensible homepage of the various apps. I really don't like this, and wish I'd stuck to the old Apple TV, which - though out of date - was a lot nicer to use, except for having to airplay Disney+. It just doesn't compare to Apple TV device, or even the Now TV stick (which I got FREE with my account, but am no longer subscribing). I suggest Amazon consider giving this stick free to Prime members. Otherwise, wish I hadn't bothered.There are much better streaming devices out there.

Name: Honesty
Review Title: Turn a TV into to a smart TV for a fraction of the price!! My #1 purchase!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 December 2020
Review Content: Amazing once set up. Can turn your basic TV into a full media desktop.. The best bit you can use your voice..To both search and stream things such as netflix, YouTube and much much more.Personally it has helped both my parents.My amazing mum because she works none stop! My step dad.. because he is blind and has mobility issues, diabetes etc so he needs alot of help!!! This is perfect because you can search via voice!Yes it'll take some getting used to, but any sort of independence is a positive and only that.Possibly the best rated item I've bought from here.. Once I got it working.You could be thinking, " it'll be difficult". but just like anything new it takes time.It's very simple, once you've had several lessons! Do not let it scare you away some change is good and this is growth at it's best.You won't regret this purchase!!I hope I've helped in some way.Merry Christmas everyone. Keep going.We will endure.All the family love these!!As they are voice controlled.. my step dad loves these being that he's blind and has mobility issues.It takes some getting used to but there's only one button to press for voice control and off you go! He's getting there and it helps with a bit of independence which is only positive for people with needs!Honestly couldn't rate this higher.. Still my best purchase.. I bought three so far..can't say I won't be back for more because I will.

Name: Lindsay R. Bayne
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: OK, so we bought this to watch the autumn rugby internationals not otherwise available - but there were several pauses in the transmission, maybe due to buffering, not sure - the picture would freeze, a blue circle appeared - when motion returned, it was poor definition, blurred. Overall, coverage needs much to be desired compared to BT and SKY, and not easy to discover coverage. We probably need to explore more, but not that satisfied.

Name: Keith_T
Review Title: Works well even with seriuosly slow broadband
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 October 2020
Review Content: We live in the country and have a an exchange only line which means - until someone pulls their finger out, broadband is horribly slow - maximum 2.6 mbps. Firestick installed simply using wifi and streams well albeit at standard definiton. - almost viewed 3 series of Man in the HIgh Castle now.... rewind and ff is a bit slow but overall everything is watchable at this speed and a wired connection which I have for my sky Q box is not needed.Definitely a real bonus especially if you already have Prime

Name: alex review
Review Title: not anything like the hassle i experienced with an alternative product
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020
Review Content: my initial review of this product is that's is super easy to set up,  everything is well packaged and the product itself is well thought out.  setup was simple to achieve.  the only thing that initially confused me was the hdmi needed the adapter dongle to be used to get the plug/socket to fit correctly.  i thought all hdmi plug/sockets are standard but obviously not - this is dealt with in the instructions anyway,  and caused nothing but a couple of seconds of puzzlement why the unit didnt fit into the hdmi socket of the tv.  5 seconds later all was well, just use the dongle adapter that's supplied.the stick was already aware of my i.d. and did a software update immediately.  how it got access to the internet i have not a clue.  part of the setup (later on) just involves adding the router password to the stick,  which is accomplished by using an onscreen keyboard and the remote control.the remote control's battery compartment is the best ive ever seen, the design is sturdy and works well.alexa works just fine using the microphone on the remote.  press and keep pressed the alexa button and speak your favourite tv program and up it comes !i cannot honestly give this amazon streaming device anything other than a 100% mark as a review.5 stars !

Name: Philip Knowles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 March 2021
Review Content: I like many others on the Amazon forums have noticed that the device will not power on from a sleep state without cycling the power switch at the wall. Quite rubbish really that I have to get up and physically switch the adapter off/on again to get it to work. Have tried all the remote buttons even the voice and nothing fixes this. Obviously an issue with the current firesticks, my old one never used to do this but alas that died after a couple of years use. Won't be replacing it nor contacting Amazon support. Naughty Jeff!

Name: kaleta
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2021
Review Content: Alex's works fine and the picture is fine, but the remote feels loose in my hand, it doesn't feel solid at all.The device itself is ok but I've had a constant problem of it not turning on and it doesn't seem to always respond to the remote, so I find myself having to take the wire out, wait abit, then put it back in for it to work, at first it wasn't so bad but now I have to do it every time I want to watch it...which is annoying. Would return it but I bought it through someone & can not be bothered with the hassle ... I only really got it to watch Disney plus & the discovery plus app thing but it doesn't seem to have the discovery one.

Name: N. Falconer
Review Title: Plenty of apps available to rejuvenate an old TV
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021
Review Content: I bought this to augment an old Toshiba Smart TV which had long since stopped running iPlayer and never had a lot of streaming app support anyway. The rest of the TV is still perfectly fine so worthwhile adding better Smart support.So far I'm happy with the Fire TV app support, everything I've installed seems to work fine, from subscription services to free service and also DLNA support.I've tested Alexa a little for finding programmes and it works, but to be honest I'm not that bothered about voice recognition.The only niggle I'm having is sometimes after powering up the TV and stick there is no picture on the HDMI input despite the TV recognising a Fire TV stick is connected.  I have to cycle the usb power to reboot the stick. and then everything is fine.  I suspect this may be a problem with the TV and when it syncs with HDMI inputs.

Name: Rebecca J.
Review Title: Turn your TV into a smart TV for pounds
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 March 2021
Review Content: Love it it’s turned my ordinary TV into a smart TV saving me £100’s!!! Bought because we wanted Disney+ and Discover+ both so easy to stream!!! I’m not technically minded but this was so easy to set up literally plugged in and downloaded the apps I wanted!!!! The voice recognition is brilliant too I’m able to press the button and ‘speak’ my choice!! Alexa works like a dream too only issue I have is sometimes this Alexa, my echo and kindle fire are all competing to answer!!! Would definitely recommend for anyone wanting the new channels but not needing or able to update to a state of the art TV just yet!! Also able to unplug and switch tv mid show with no issues which helps when ready for bed but the show hasn’t finished!!

Name: Ella Sarip
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 October 2020
Review Content: I didn't realize I still had a 1st generation FireTv Stick wich was starting to playing up before dying. This new version is way better and faster. The remote works and is easier to use. Works good with Alexa apart from an application called ViKi. When I pause it works, but when I want to resume the video Alexa doesn't recognise the command for that application but I guess it doesn't have much to do with the functionality of this FireTv.

Name: Simon Says
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020
Review Content: I bought a FireStick simply for My5 that had stopped working on my smart TV. I had used Amazon Prime on my Ipad and streamed it to my TV but the FireStick now mitigates the need to do this.The unit was very easy to set up and link to my Prime account and this opened up a new world of programmes which has been it most beneficial attribute. I now find I use the FireStick for most of our programs, having found a wealth of drama's like The Night Watchman, Goliath and Damages which are all high-quality programs unavailable on terrestrial tv.Alexa is a useful addition, allowing you to ask to find particular program categories or simply the days weather.With a bit of fiddling, I have also managed to get Italian TV by using a VPN app. Its a bit pedantic in its use but at least I can catch the news and a few Rai programs without the need for a satellite dish.Costing less than £20 (a Black Friday deal) I can't complain as it is used daily and provides far more options for viewing given the lacklustre offerings from many terrestrial tv stations.

Name: Carryonvending
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 October 2020
Review Content: Item arrived - Well packaged. Plug into HDMI port and powered from USB on the TV.Within seconds - Updating softwareDo you want to use your existing account & Network ?Updates installed. What apps do  you want. Downloaded and installedDisney+ Login & PW  - and away we go.Outstandingly easy, and all for £29.99BARGAIN

Name: Yang
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 December 2020
Review Content: I have purchased a couple of fire sticks previously and am generally happy with them (the remote control for one of them failed and I had to use mobile app to control the stick). Unfortunately the latest one I purchased apparently has some faults/defectives as it produces clicking noise and flashing screen every few minutes. To my disappointment, I have contacted the supplier and reported the defective, the automatic reply says a replacement will be sent to me with no additional charge. However after a week time, still nothing happens. I tried to get in touch with customer care via online chat, but was thrown to online help page with no single human reply. It's really a bad experience.

Name: Charles Foran
Review Title: Not as described due to Error PLR_PRS_CALL_FAILED
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2020
Review Content: How ridiculous that the product that is specifically made for its own company's video streaming service refuses to play those videos from the get go and no amount of tweaking, changing settings,  rebooting and running through online forums looking for the non-existent silver bullet will fix it. As a long time echo user i am sorely disappointed in Amazon for letting customers down with such a buggy product.  My intention was to buy two more for TVs in my house, but that certainly will not happen now. I am looking at my echos as well as I wanted an integrated system.

Name: Reaper
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 February 2021
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: BlueberryPi
Review Title: So much better than previous models!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021
Review Content: Bought this on a black Friday deal, as we had the first generation Fire Stick and it was struggling to say the least. With Prime Video it was usually okay, but Netflix was awful with constant freezing and stuttering (even with fast broadband).With this model, video playback on anything is absolutely superb! No buffering or audio issues, it just plays. I most often use Prime Video, Netflix and stream NHK World Japan and honestly it's a joy after months of frustration with the last one.I've also downloaded Earth Cam, allowing me to view webcams all over the world. The image quality from these is just superb in 720P or 1080P (dependent on camera selected).The voice remote works well when it wants to, but other times it just won't search with voice. But when it does, even with strong accents it finds what you want right away.I couldn't find a straight answer before purchasing whether this would solve playback issues compared to the first gen. But it really does.Absolute best purchase I've made in a while now that we can enjoy movies and series when we want with no unexpected drama!For anyone who hasn't used one before, it couldn't be any easier to set up. Just plug in and follow the easy instructions. Then enjoy searching the many apps to find what you want.

Name: The Old Clucker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2021
Review Content: I have the TV stick with Alexa and tv controls on my main smart tv and wanted to update the tv stick on my bedroom tv as it was getting on a bit and wasn't up to streaming high demand apps such as Disney+/STAR. It was taking ages to load some apps and had the spinning disc of doom quite often, or the picture freezing. I was so impressed with the latest stick with tv controls but couldn't justify the extra money for a tv I don't use that often so I decided to get the Amazon Fire TV stick Lite without tv controls. It's absolutely fab! The tv and firestick are plugged into an Amazon smart plug so I just tell Alexa to turn the plug on and then use the tv control to select which 'source' ie; the firestick  and then use the firestick control to choose what I want to stream, not needing to touch the amazon fire stick control again, and using the tv control for volume control. Unless i want to skip through something then obviously have to use the firestick control. But it's no problem at all having to use the tv remote infact to be honest, it's a lot simpler, well for me anyway.It's very fast, loads in seconds and no spinning circle of death while it loads apps. Over the moon with it. Infact to be honest, wish I'd bought the lite for the main tv now but never mind. They're both great products. I can highly recommend both.

Name: Tom B
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2020
Review Content: The picture quality, ability to link to other Alexa devices and the sheer scale of available apps for the Fire TV stick make it a great buy. I realise most people will already have smart TVs etc by now but trust me, the Fire TV is the best bet for ensuring apps are always up to date and working optimally - especially as TV manufacturers discontinue support for their models on a regular basis.This iteration is particularly easy to use and the Alexa Voice Remote, even without any other Alexa device integration, does a fantastic job on it's own and makes finding whatever you are looking for (regardless of the application) really simple.Recommended for anyone looking to boost their viewing options!

Name: Sutton Coldfield caz
Review Title: Very easy to implement even for those not very tech savvy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 November 2020
Review Content: Very easy to set up and run.  Bought mainly to watch films rather than continue to buy DVD's  so using Amazon Prime at the moment but may consider Netflix later. One thing which I came unstuck on were those apps you have to pay for.  Now my husband is a dinasor  and does not use a computer, mobile phone etc  Went for a bath and left him with the remote and the next day I find a debit from Amazon for a The Chase App -  a programme he hates and somehow he had bought it -  he doesn't know how but I can see it is easy to do. Wonderful Amazon deleted it and refunded and suggested I avoid it again by adding parental controls which allow purchases only on implementation of a code known only to me  -  parental controls for a 73 year old  !!!  That has been done now so should avoid that issue again.  One more thing -  did have to adjust the tv because the instructions across the top to enable me to select options was off the screen. Easy enough to do in the technical section.  Suggest it is worth while spending sometime playing about with all the screens so you get a feel for what you can do to make it an even better experience.  Certainly turning out to be value for money  - watching a film on Amazon prime virtually every night.

Name: Mr. M. D. MCMAHON
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 April 2021
Review Content: We bought this to watch live sports streams from Amazon Prime. We wanted something less faffy than hooking up a laptop computer to the TV - which did work well but my wife found it too complicated and inconvenient mto control. The TV is a 9-year-old Panasonic and is unable to link itself to Amazon Prime, which some more-modern TVs can.I was not disappointed. The device was easy to set up, though I was initially puzzled by the hand control unit - not immediately obvious that navigation is performed by pressing the bezel surrounding the "select" button.My dear wife struggles with technology and I was wondering how she would cope. She not only took to it readily and worked it out for herself - she discovered that the TV control handset would also control the Fire Stick - the appropriate buttons function on it in the same manner as those on the proper handset! Effectively a one-control solution - though not in the way advertised. The Fire Stick seems to recognise the Panasonic handset signals; I don't know how. Has anyone else experienced this?Yes, I am very pleased with this. It works well from our Wi-Fi and gives a sharp, clear, steady picture.We have not bothered with the voice control so far. The hand controls work so well we don't need to.

Name: Dan
Review Title: Next time think I'd get the one with TV controls.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 February 2021
Review Content: Works really well, loads of channels to choose from and I'm not on prime or anything, so I just get the free stuff. In terms of setting up, it took almost no effort, which on one hand made was great, on the other, was a little worrying. I assume it connected with the echo dot I have and got all the WiFi details from that, because I didn't have to do anything to connect it and when I checked the details for the connection, it was connected to the correct network with the correct password.In terms of appearance, fits behind the TV neatly and takes power from one of the TVs USB ports, so it's basically invisible. I'm on basic broadband, so speeds of upto 8MB/s and picture quality etc seems great, but I also live alone, so perhaps if you had more people taking up the bandwidth it might have issues.I've not used it a lot, when I bought my house it had a TV wall mount in a room I don't really watch TV in, so bought a cheap TV to cover it only to realise that there were no satellite or aerial sockets in the room. Tried a couple of different indoor aerials, but could only ever get a couple of channels, this essentially makes the TV viable again, though it doesn't get a lot of use.Voice controls seem fine, but the TV doesn't automatically go into standby when you put the firestick into sleep mode, so the control with a TV standby button would probably have been better.Have lowered my rating by one star as have just found out there is no voice command to put the firestick itself into sleep mode, you have to do it manually.

Name: Tom.T
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2020
Review Content: Great value alltho I'd say the 4k stick is also good value and worth the extra especially if you buy when on sale. I feel the firestick lite was released in a hurry as some of the mainstream apps weren't working at release like BBC and a few others alltho I believe these are all minor issues and all resolved my only complaint is some sideloaded apps load without their icons showing which seems abit of a petty slightly spiteful thing to change but maybe that will be resolved also. But I paid £20 each for these lite versions on sale and you get alot for your money even at full price they're brilliant fully fledged firesticks with newer operating system and work very well, the volume control and power buttons are omitted but it's so cheap it matters not , and for not much more you can buy the version with those extra controls the choice is yours. I personally rate the firestick lite very highly and is a great idea to have a cheaper version that still as good for those who are struggling financially or just want a spare for bedrooms or travelling. A1 Amazon.

Name: Michael Webb
Review Title: I bought this to watch BBCi player as advertised.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 October 2020
Review Content: I tried to use it to receive BBCi player.  However I cannot get it to work. So for me it's a complete waste of money. If anyone can help me I would be most grateful.

Name: A. J. Maclean
Review Title: Great value Great quality and ease of use
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2021
Review Content: I bought the Fire Stick Lite for the TV in my bedroom. It's an old small flat screen TV (2006) that is barely used because it's picture quality, sound etc is pretty poor against todays TVs. However, plug in a Fire stick and all that changes. I was amazed at the improvement to sound and picture quality  via the Fire Stick Lite. I was genuinely thinking of getting rid of this TV but not any more. I'm not one for watching TV in bed but after seeing and hearing the difference I've  changed my mind and given the TV a reprieve. You do need to remember that you can't control your TV with the Fire Stick Lite or Alexa voice but how hard is it to turn up the volume or turn the TV on and off using the TVs own remote? The Fire Stick Lite works the same as the full Fire Stick. You can use the buttons or use Alexa to perform the functions for you. I already have a full Fire Stick on my main TV and was pleased to find that the 2 fire sticks integrated with each other during the setup process. This meant that all my preferences, movies etc that I had saved on my main Fire Stick were transferred to the Fire Stick Lite with no lose whatsoever. Its really great value for money and I would definitely recommend it.

Name: Constantgardner
Review Title: Simple to use for something that does so much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2021
Review Content: I'm in my 90s, don't have very dexterous hands and have reached the stage when I can't be bothered to learn new technology, so my son set this up for me and wrote some basic instructions on how to use the remote.To my surprise I've got the hang of it quite quickly, I like being able to ask Alexa, such a polite young lady, to play music by style or artist or to find programmes. Getting to learn the words to use is a bit of trial and error but we get there in the end.iPlayer works like it does on the PC more or less, similar videos are just below rather than to the side and I've found things I never knew were there, like the live corral reef cam.Using the direction and select buttons is the same as with any remote and unlike my computer I don't feel I can do anything so stupid it will rash.Lastly my son says I should mention that I don't have a particularly fast Internet speed, it runs at between 4 and 10mbps but the picture on my 24" TV is perfectly fine and there's only a brief pause while things load, then no buffering at all.I think if I can use it anyone can, it's technology for people who don't like technology.

Name: Bob Owen
Review Title: 2020 Fire TV Stick Lite, way better than the 2016 Fire TV Box.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2021
Review Content: I bought the Fire TV Box in the photo 5 years ago because it was 4 core and the old Stick was 2 core at the time.  But the wifi was hopeless on the Box both in terms of the 5GHzchannels it could receive and the signal strength.  The new Stick Lite supports the full range of 5 GHz channels from 36 to at least 157 that my Oppo 5G router puts out and the received signal strength is always very good.  The 4 cores in the new Stick Lite are at least as good or better than the old Box and take up a fraction of the space and electrical power.  I am getting used to the new UI but I am struggling with the TV button on the remote because the old Box remote did not have the TV button.  I don't seem to be able to disable the TV button either but maybe I can slice it off cleanly with a new Stanley blade?  At least the old Box did me a favour by dying and forcing me to buy the new Stick Lite so I am pleased about that and the old Box will make a nice drink mat.PS  I sliced the TV button off with a Stanley blade in a window scraper so the remote is perfect now, see photo.

Name: Read-a-holic
Review Title: Turns my TV into smart TV
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2020
Review Content: Bought this device while on special offer for 17.99 so thought was worth a shot for the price and I am quite impressed with it, was easy to install and like the fact that you can use voice command on the remote, however does not come with any instructions worth mentioning, had to go to YouTube to find what the device is capable of, no tutorials on the device that I'm aware of anyway. Also, not very impressed with Amazon Prime as a lot of the content is to rent or buy, even quite old films and TV content, I'm already paying 7.99 a month, should not have to fork out more to watch content, of course some are free to view, just not all of it what I necessarily want to watch, thankfully there's other ways to stream so for that this is good as I don't have a fancy smart TV, which essentially, is what this device does, so now I can watch all the catch up channels on my TV instead of my phone as I no longer subscribe to Sky or Virgin media so don't have the ability to record programmes anymore, so catch up is essential for me

Name: Kevin Warrington
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 February 2021
Review Content: TV without an aerial connection and no smart apps, so a simple Fire stick seemed to be the best solution. Everything needed is in the box and set up is simple. Loads of additional apps to download if needed and the only tedious bit is registering your account for each of the streaming apps, whihc took a little time.Video output is 720P, whihc is a bit odd as it is a 1080P TV - and I can't see any option to change this. As it is a small screen and we mostly use it to listen to radio stations, it isn't a problem.Cannot get the hang of using Alexa, so just use the simple remote control.I've found a couple of minor problems: first, if I turn the TV off, when I turn it back on again, the sound is lost and I need to power cycle the Firestick to recover. secondly, there is no obvious way to turn the firestick off, other than removing power, so it seems that it will sit there streaming data all the time.In summary - it does what I needed and hoped it would do and was **MUCH** cheaper than the alternatives of installing an aerial lead or buying a new smart TV

Name: RKaur
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 January 2021
Review Content: I bought this after my Sky box stopped working and my TV does not connect well to the wireless. It provides access to the main apps. Picture quality is good for the price. Maybe not as sharp and sometimes it goes a little blocky with busy pictures like birds flying on animal programmes, but it is negligible. I haven't tried Alexa on it.It did have a couple of glitches with sound disappearing after switching the TV off and on without sending the stick to sleep first and buffering, but switching the stick off or restarting fixed it. No major problems so far. It also has mirroring.The home menu could be better to access the apps, it instead has a strip of some of your apps. The rest of the screen has recommended programmes and promotional material. You have to go into another page to see all your downloaded apps.It was too wide to slot into the side HDMI port on the TV. I had another HDMI cable in the back of the TV so had to use the extension for the stick because there was not enough room for it. It does hang down as a result but hasn't disconnected. It plugs in with USB to plug, although it could probably be slotted into a USB port on the TV for power.Overall, a cheap way to access apps if TV isn't smart or has wireless problems. Maybe expensive models have better picture quality but it is acceptable on this one. Does the job and I would recommend it. I might try the next model up at some point and keep this for the spare TV.

Name: EddieB
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2021
Review Content: There are already so many good feedback points made that there is little I can add other than it was almost a simple plug and play once I had realised it was the the network password and not the Router needed.I am 70 years old and had computers ever since they evolved from simple 1MB games machines, so I am pretty well up on techy bits and I found this streaming add-on way simpler than others I played around with (cheap versions) over the last 5 or 6 years. Great picture and virtually no time lapse.The time lapse that I mean are the many you get when using other systems . A TV in one room using Freeview is a fraction ahead of the TV using Virgin Tivo boxes and even then if you look at The BBC news on 601 (on Virgin) and the BBC news on 101 (still on Virgin) the images are a good second later on 601. I can watch BBC TV on my PC stream it to the Lounge and finding, loading and playing is way faster than watching it on the slow buffering Virgin Tivo boxes.

Name: Martin Koss
Review Title: Dreadful - No sound through HDMI - only Bluetooth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 February 2021
Review Content: I have an original FireStick and other than being painfully slow, it worked.This is the second of the new versions (I originally bought the 4K version to have on a 4K monitor on my desk but that failed because the 4K only works on a Smart TV (as tech support told me) so I bout the 'lite' version (as advised by Amazon Tech Support) but it too does not output any sound via HDMI, only BlueTooth.I have spent hours looking at so many 'tips' on the web about how to fix this but nothing worked.I even did a factory reset and still no sound through HDMI.I know all my cables and the system works because I have a HDMI BluRay player in the same system and the sound gets to my sound bar absolutely fine - but not from the FireStick. I've swapped cables, tested everything and everything works except sound from FireTV / FireStick Lite. Terrible system.Very badly designed.Would NOT recommend this.

Name: Organum
Review Title: Fab but pity about the USB power
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2020
Review Content: Amazed at how much faster is than my old stick. Really responsive and apps like Britbox fully useable now.My only gripe, hence the 4 stars, is that when using the TV as the power source (like my last stick) periodically a warning comes up tha not enough power is supplied but the unit works just fine. To have a power lead dangling down the wall for an adapter is a no no in my hour !

Name: T. I. Charlesworth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 February 2021
Review Content: I bought this as my Sony Bravia 5 year old smart TV has never been able to get ITV and is now saying that BBC iplayer is overloading it . Very poor and has put me off the brand . I was eying up a new TV to get over these issues, despite the TV still delivering an excellent picture.  Starting to feel a bit miffed over spending another £600 when I thought of getting a fire stick. For under £20 I have now got a fully functioning smart TV . ITV , no problem  BBC no problem........what is even more amazing is that my Sony TV appears to have  " learned " how to operate the fire stick so I only have to use the one remote ! I have no idea how this happened , it was certainly nothing I did , I'm not that clever.  Great product.  So pleased ,that the next TV I buy for a different room may be a non smart model with a fire stick....I'm thinking that,  knowing Amazon , it may be more " future proof " .

Name: Peter C
Review Title: Latest Addition to the Fire stick Range
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: I bought the Fire stick lite in the recent Black Friday sale, a great price for for an entry level product.  Firstly, I would say the streaming quality at the max 1080p is really smooth with no buffering or juddering during playback. Comes with the latest Amazon launcher interface which is a welcome addition. As a user of NowTV this is now available on the Lite and works great.  On a down side the 1GB memory is very small considering the lite uses around 650mb to run leaving you with 350mb to run your programs like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube and other apps you might add.  If you don't have an 4K TV this would be a great chose for casual use.  Finally, to get the best performance from this product regularly restart the fire stick to refresh the memory to keep it performing at it's it peak, however I would recommend you do this on whichever fire stick you own, it's just good house keeping.

Name: Becky287
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2020
Review Content: When it works, it’s fine. First one was faulty and had to be returned. Had our replacement for a couple of weeks now and beginning to see a similar fault. When the tv is first turned on the firestick isn’t detected and the remote won’t turn it on (tv shows no input detected) so having to resort to unplugging and plugging it back in. This is not a consistent fault with this replacement, and our original firestick (fully working just replaced by the firestick lite to include Alexa voice search) was in the same HDMI port without issue so I have to believe it’s a fault with the product...

Name: E. King
Review Title: Good stick. Had problems with the stick freezing/locking up, problem is resolved now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2021
Review Content: I had problems with the stick freezing up, I'd start watching something and after a short time the picture would freeze and the remote wouldnt work (also happened in the menus when left idling). But it turned out not to be the stick but instead my TV. I had to switch my TV from HDMI_2 to HDMI_1 then back to HDMI_2 and everything came back to life. Weird, I have a basic TV, but on the other hand I never had problems with HDMI_2 before when I had a dvd player plugged in to it.FireTV Support take notice of this, because when you gave me support you didn't suggest testing the TV, instead you had me checking for updates and factory resetting the FireTV stick, which didn't solve the problem.I notice in the reviews many people mention the stick freezing up, maybe there is a problem with the stick telling the TV's HDMI input that the stick is alive, so to speak.

Name: John Robson
Review Title: Absolutely a PIA to pair, can't get any response ..... so frustrating
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 March 2021
Review Content: A piece of technology like this should pair straight out of the box, it did not. Since the functioning of the device depends on the pairing of the remote (yes I know there is an app, why doesn't it recognise my Amazon sign in password?) you would expect it to be pre-paired to enable plug and play operation, it was not. Then you would hope that the fundamental task of resetting the pairing would be simple, no it is not, anything but! Following the instructions on Amazons own site did not pair the device, nor did any of the many other web sites instructions. This is so basic and fundamental that a switched on company would make this a simple seamless operation, Amazon I am afraid this is definitely not.  Please rethink, why no simple pairing button or pairing code system? Really, come on, get a grip. All the other functionality may be great but if you can't 'fire up' your Firestick.....

Name: wanderer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 November 2020
Review Content: Bought for bedroom TV so TV remote function of no interest ,Set up took around 15 minutes ,10 of those updating , Longest part , logging into various accounts ,5 minutes in Settings adjusting video and audio to TV and job done ,One of 3 Firestick in the house so used to operation and all working seamlessly , Easily install couple of third party apps which are working as they should, Don't bother with Alexa on any of the Firesticks ,have 5 Echos around the house so no real point ,Same with voice control ,find remote control quicker ,Never had any issues with Firestick , always mains powered ,using TV USB can cause way too many issues , Keep Bluetooth devices to a minimum ,can interfere with 2.4 g wifi , otherwise ,enjoy ,Read all the product details before you buy ,

Name: C
Review Title: If you have to return a faulty one dont send the cables or plug with it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 March 2021
Review Content: This was a replacement for a faulty fire stick. I was told to send the original one back with everything apart from the remote control. When the reconditioned replacement arrived it was on its own with no cables. I can’t tell you how difficult it’s been to get the cables replaced. I did get the HDML extension lead sent and I have had a credit for a long HDML lead but I’ve no plug and it’s too difficult to try to get this resolved

Name: clive squire
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: This has to be one of the best purchases I have made on amazon in 8 years!!! I can't wait to leave my current TV supplier there is more legal channels & movieson the fire tv lite than I will watch in my lifetime so many great apps available also I got mine Via Alexa so I saved 20 quid now I think it's 17.99!!! Absolute bargain we also have Netflix & Disney subscriptions and now I also have Amazon prime with Amazon music all integrated nicely also the latest update is nice and fresh if you like tv and movies it's a must I will probably never go out again!!!!!! Thanks.

Name: Nick
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020
Review Content: We're a household that already has an Amazon Echo, several Echo Dots, a Fire tablet and integrated Nest thermostat so we're very familiar with Alexa. Not having the absolute newest TV I went for the Lite version of the Fire TV Stick as I didn't expect the TV to support full control.Pleasantly surprised to find that the Fire Stick can actually turn the TV on and off so all that's missing really is volume control which is no biggie. Also pleasantly surprised to find how easy it is to integrate the Fire Stick with Alexa so almost everything you need to do can be done by talking to the Echo in the room. We haven't explored many of the multitude of apps available yet. We got this item in late November 2020 so we've been binge-watching West Wing on All4 in order to remind ourselves what it's like to have intelligent, capable people in the White House and get up to speed before January. Oh, before I go I should also point out that there's a  very good Android app (other phones are available) so pretty much everything the standard Fire Stick remote can do can be done from your phone.So to sum up: We expected the setup and operation to be really easy and it was. Quality of service is excellent with glitch-free viewing. It integrates well with Alexa and the apps work exactly as they should. Brilliantly simple and simply brilliant.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: It’s a right faff, don’t bother
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2020
Review Content: Very hard to navigate with so many different apps and subscription channels convoluting it all.I pay for prime video and therefore want easy access to the channels that are included and already covered by my membership/subscription payments. Yet when searching for anything I am always directed to pay per view channels such as Starplayz, which I have absolutely no interest in when I already pay a subscription for prime video.The latest update looks to have tidied things up a little, however I have had to manually reinstate all my user profiles and my child can no longer access his profile at all because “Child profiles are not supported on Fire TV at this time”! Seriously! This is unbelievable! The schools have broken up for the Christmas holidays and my child cannot watch any of his shows or films! Absolutely ridiculous!The other issue I have is with the remote... When using the function ring to skip back and forth, it is far too easy to accidentally press the Home button instead of the Play/Pause button. This may seem an insignificant design flaw, but when you have accidentally hit it and been taken back to the Home Screen to then have to log back into prime video, select your profile and then hunt for the show you were just watching (because it’s not set out very well at all and there is no clear “continue watching” option) for the twentieth time, it becomes rather infuriating and that is when it gets turned off and I switch back to NowTV.So if I were you, just get NowTV and don’t bother with all this faff.

Name: Clementi
Review Title: Just had SECOND fire stick break
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 April 2021
Review Content: Yet again, the Fire Stick has broken.  I’ve used ALL Amazon power sources and connectors (they will tell you to use them if yours breaks),  streaming fine and suddenly just broke.  No real reset despite them giving you rather silly instructions.  And now, the second one has broken.  Amazon say ‘buy another one’ (cheek of it), I say forget it.Seriously, when one broke I thought ‘OK, maybe it’s a one-off’ and bought another, but now the second one has broken.It’s a joke.  Yes, I can use the app, but I pay for channels and you can ONLY receive the channels via the stick.Amazon:  Either make a stick which works for a sensible amount of time, of ensure that ALL of the channels are available on the app.  This is nuts.

Name: J. P. Thompson
Review Title: Bringing a TV into the 21st century !
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 February 2021
Review Content: This is an easy way to bring an old tv up to date by allowing you to watch all the streaming and catch up services available. I have a LG tv from 2010, so it`s only HD and therefore I didn`t need the Fire 4K version. But this still gives a decent picture on a portable telly. I`ve only installed a few services so far (iPlayer,All4 and Youtube) but that`s plenty to watch for now. It`s easy enogh to set up-just plug it in to the back of the tv and power it up.Then it updates itself and you then add the apps you want. I don`t use Alexa , so can`t say how well it works. But the thing I like most is that I`m in charge of what to watch,so if there`s only rubbish on the main channels I can always find something to watch that I enjoy on Prime or YT.

Name: Soyful Alam
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: Purchased this to replace my 2nd Generation Firestick for the bedroom which was a few years old.It’s a lot smaller then my previous Fire TV Stick.The interface is much quicker as well.It doesn’t lose much speed when using Wi-Fi.Only downside is the side loaded Apps do not show the picture in the icon on the Home Screen but this is a minor issue.I still have the 2nd Generation Fire TV box in the living room and they are both running on the Quad Processor.All in all I’m happy with the purchase and I got it for the reduced price of £19.99 which in my opinion is a bargain.I’m waiting for the next Generation Fire TV Box or Cube to upgrade the living room box which is over 5 years old now.5 stars from me.

Name: R-Dodger
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 November 2020
Review Content: Update:-I've had this Lite Fire Stick for a while now and I must say that it is still blazingly fast, far faster than all my other Firesticks, even my 4K stick. It was upgraded to OS 7 some time ago and I like the new UI, but for the price it is far and away the fastest streaming stick I own, the response to button presses on it's remote are near instantaneous. Full disclosure; I do have it hooked up to ethernet via a third party adaptor.This unit replaced a much older iteration of the fire stick and I must say that the difference is like night and day. The fire stick light is so fast at responding to the remote control that I couldn't believe it. The picture quality is very very good. If you don't need the volume controls on the more expensive fire sticks, then get this one.

Name: Chris
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 May 2021
Review Content: Purchased for 2 reasons: 1. To get the UKTVPlay player, as my old TV can't get it, and specifically chose Fire TV Stick, since you can get an Ethernet adapter for it, which I also bought, as it is connected via Powerline Adapters, not Wi-Fi. One can edit which apps are on the main screen, except Amazon ones, so even thought I've not signed up to Prime, I'm stuck with them being continuously pushed in my face. Since Amazon have a credit card associated with my account, I'm scared to use some of its features, in case Amazon goes ahead and charges me for them, without making it clear. Just like they are always trying to trick customers into signing up for a Prime membership Trial. I haven't been able to find the STV player.

Name: Giapetto
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2020
Review Content: Simple enough to install and operate (my Alexa has been banished to a drawer so that's not been part of the experience), but not too stable. I have had to uninstall and reinstall it three times now because of problems. Also the pairing /twinning function I find almost impossible to make work. We really need better user instructions, preferably written on paper.

Name: Jack Brookes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 February 2021
Review Content: About this product of you weeks ago go Looks  just as good as any Amazon productsWhat does this product  doIt allows you to watch Amazon Prime  Netflix  BBC iPlayer  and much more  Play games How does the product differ from the competition3 How does the product differ from the competitionThe interface is much quicker as well It doesn’t lose much speed when using Wi-Fisetting up, it took almost no effort, which on one hand made was greatThe new Stick Lite supports the full range of 5 GHz channels from 36 to at least 157 that my Oppo 5G router puts out and the received signal strength is always very good I also have Amazon prime with Amazon music all integrated nicely also the latest update is nice and fresh if you like tv and movies it's a must I will probably never go out again!

Name: BPL
Review Title: A TV stick with great potential but ....
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 April 2021
Review Content: What’s not to like about a convenient TV stick that is easy to set up and you can command with Alexa ease. Well for me it was it’s disappointing picture playback which juddered! Don’t get me wrong it was sharp and appealing but it simply wasn’t smooth! And that got irritating!Now for some you’ll love it for all the apps you get in one place or perhaps you want access to top telly in your mobile home or somewhere where an aerial or set top box just isn’t an option . If that’s you and you have a good WiFi connection then this may be your easy solution as you just plug into a HDMI and a power supply and away you go!!For me however my set top boxes simply out perform it . And I don’t like the rugged playback as it gets irritating as I’m not used to that compromise.So I award this device with potential a 1 star as after poor customer care and a waste of time technical support from Amazon all I have achieved is a lot of wasting time and trip to return it back in the mail .Goodbye Fire 🔥 Stick come visit me again when gasoline is poured over you and you can impress me more!

Name: Baz
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2020
Review Content: So after hours of trying to get this thing set up I gave up. First fault find was the plug supplied doesn’t power the Fire stick, used my own and got to the home page then no sound, tried to sort that out but it kept shutting down. So after losing many hours of my life I won’t be getting back thinking I was to blame, I contacted customer support. Jumped through some hoops to come full circle back to the beginning again and no working Fire stick. I was then informed that they will replace the Fire Stick but not the accessories. Mind boggling as the plug is part of the issue (You wouldn’t accept an iPhone that doesn’t let you charge it from an Apple plug) so now I am left with the inconvenience of having to post this junk back to them to get a refund, marvellous.

Name: Lovely
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 November 2020
Review Content: Brilliant. I have switched from NowTV to this because they no longer offer vouchers and this is part of my Amazon prime and I already have Netflix so I am not paying for anything extra :) there are certain films etc you have to pay for, however, I won't, it defeats the object of having it! It's fast, the picture quality is brilliant and easy to set up - it just sits in the HDMI port, in the back of the TV and it takes you through the set up, when it is on. So far, so good! Very easy set up. Highly recommended

Name: Mystery shopper
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2021
Review Content: I like devices that make me look competent by needing very little actual thinking to operate.  I had this out of its wrapper and installed in about 5 minutes...which is my world record.  I admit I struggled with remembering my Amazon password a bit but that was the hardest part since I always use my favourite swear words for a giggle and unusually had used something non-rude for this site.  Now I have Amazon and, cough, that other movie streaming site in my bedroom as well as the living room and kitchen and I am truly spoiled for entertainment. I watched Dirty Dancing for the 500th time tonight and have Top Gun and The Full Monty on standby.  Lockdown is so much more fun with an Amazon Fire Stick in every room in your house. Get one. Get several.

Name: saxplayer67
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2020
Review Content: My son wanted Disney+ from Father Christmas, so the man in red got him a Fire Stick Lite and left the monthly subs up to me. :)  It was a good idea, otherwise he'd have had to watch it only on his phone, now it can be on our TV.  Picture etc fine, shame the remote doesn't have a power button but you have to fiddle around and get to the sleep option onscreen.Initially plugged the stick into a four way HDMI switcher (after rerouting all plugs, including the stick's, on a trailing extension socket) but it was staticky popping picture and sound, so redid connections, plugged the stick straight into one of the TV's HDMI ports and then routed everything else through the HDMI switcher, to the other HDMI port on the TV and all good.  SO the takeaway is that the stick doesn't like going through anything other than the TV's HDMI port.

Name: richyt
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 May 2021
Review Content: I have a TV in the kitchen which is out of reach of a satellite or tv aerial connection, so I went for this as a solution. What a brilliant piece of kit. I went for the basic lite version; I don't need it to adjust the tv volume. Once connected to the tv via an hdmi socket, it was easy to connect to my home network. Once it had updated itself with the latest software, it was up and running. It was easy to find my Prime account, so I could carry on watching stuff from there. Access to other streaming services, such as BBC Iplayer and ITV hub just needed the relevant apps downloading. It comes with Alexa, but I don't need this, so just use the handset. Ideal for what I wanted.

Name: Ed
Review Title: So, so, so much better than 1st Gen Fire TV Stick
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2021
Review Content: We tried the first generation fire tv stick, and it was so painfully slow to start up, or to open apps, that we went back to a Chromecast. This new one is light years ahead. It's still a tiny bit laggy at times, but the new layout makes it really easy to find content - you can watch live tv with TV Player, or with the apps for the channels (which you can't do with a Chromecast), and the voice recognition works well for Amazon content (although it won't work with finding tv programmes in iPlayer for example). Finally it has Alexa built in when you press the mic button, which may be helpful for some people (though we don't make use of it). Good value, especially when on sale.

Name: Steven A. McKay
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: We got our teenage daughter's old TV for our bedroom when she got a new smart TV but it's pretty old, so I suggested getting a new one for us too. Wife didn't really think we needed one, so I got this instead. Wow, for under £20 or whatever it cost, it's fantastic. We have Prime, Netflix and Spotify so this is really everything we need and means we don't have to bother shelling out on a smart TV for a couple of years!I'd highly recommend this to anyone with an older TV looking for an upgrade but maybe not wanting to spend too much or even for grandparents with an older TV in a kids room so they can get Netflix and stuff on it when the kids visit after lockdown!

Name: Geoff S
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2020
Review Content: Really easy to install.  However first pictures of rugby were blurred and kept pausing before jumping on about every second so eventually gave up and watched on digital channel.  Next game much better but last weekend Wales v England it returned kept going away then returning. Will stick with it for final. Let’s hope okEverything else was a great picture do not know why like this for rugby games

Name: Paul-Lancs
Review Title: Great To Make Old Samsung TV Smart, but..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: Wrong URL for starters. Amazon.co.uk/code is now /mytvSends an email and then, if that's not good enough, send a link via SMS which doesn't open.Gets to Amazon and wants to change my password. Derr, happy with the secure password I already have. Not happy with that episode of 'let's waste our customers time for longer'.Then, once I phoned India, time expired code.Anyway, finally it was connected *breath again* and it's turned normal Samsung TV into a Smart one. Now I don't lose Smart-ness when my HHD TV Record is recording.Unlike Panasonic, I can uninstall BBC iPlayer. Yay, and now it's out of the way.

Name: George Paterson
Review Title: Does it do as the advert says?  Answer: YES!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 February 2021
Review Content: Plugged  it into the power socket and TV, switched to the right HDMI port and, Hey Presto, now have more choices  to select from.  You have to download which extra TV Channel Supplier you would like to access, these I  downloaded from Amazon.  Some are FREE, others you have to purchase.  I already had Amazon Prime (£7.99 per month, and worth every penny) and am "trialling" Amazon Music (3 month free trial, if you sign-up after that then a monthly payment of £7.99).  If you are fed-up with the continual repeats of TV shows, films, etc., then this Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa Voice Remote Lite HD streaming device is your saviour.  Recommend it for those who like watching movies or listening to music, far greater choices than standard TV Channels!  The Alexa allows you to SPEAK  your requested choices rather than have to press buttons on the remote, plus has many other facilities you might find useful!  VERY PLEASED with mine!! George Paterson, Senior Gentleman.

Name: Lee Hodson
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2021
Review Content: My Firestick Lite is plugged into a projector's HDMI port with the USB power cable plugged into an OTG adaptor which is plugged into the projector's USB port. The Firestick works great. I use it for games, music and videos. My only upsets are that there is limited internal storage space and that the user interface could be better organised. With the addition of an external USB drive (via the OTG adaptor) and a gamepad, the Firestick Lite makes quite the home entertainment system.I would buy one of these again. I look forward to trying the next generation of Firestick Lite and hope it includes more RAM and more internal storage.

Name: ziggy1982
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 December 2020
Review Content: Fantastic product. Literally gave my 2013 model of LG smart TV a new lease of life. Since LG gradually removed all apps from the TV overtime, it rendered previously smart TV basically obsolete as only Netflix and Amazon apps were left. Now I can enjoy it all over again. Very happy as the older TV is still in excellent working order and new 4K TVs don’t come with 3D and I own plenty of 3D blu ray discs that I love, so fire stick literally saved it from going into garbage and saved me a pretty penny on buying a new TV. Also, one stick works on both TVs, one in the lounge and the other one in the bedroom. Simply perfect. Bought it only sale for £17.99, even cheaper than during Black Friday.

Name: miss ms
Review Title: No tv aerial solution for watching tv and a lot more, brilliant.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Brilliant piece of kit, tv aerial cable broke for the last 10 years, so been relying on old skybox for free view, which is limited and repetitive . And also having to rely on PS4 for other channels. The Firestick has given me more than enough free channels to keep me entertained all night. Love the replay and pause, and uktvplay channel. This is ideal if you haven't got a working tv aerial, all done through WiFi. Would of purchased sooner if I knew it was all received by WiFi. Registering and linking your chosen channel apps to your tv takes time, but once done it’s their forever, no logins after linking, highly recommend. Also you do not have to ask Alexa to view your apps which I do find annoying, you can just use the remote it does it all.

Name: Max
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2021
Review Content: The Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa Voice Remote Lite worth every penny. I should buy it earlier. The instruction is clear and easy to understand. After connecting the stick to the TV, just follow the instruction on TV and takes a few minutes to set up. Although it does not come with TV controls, it is not a problem for me at all. My TV is more than 10 years old, the image quality is a high standard, much better than I expected. The only downside is the limited language choices on Alexa voice control.Bought this as a Christmas present at the last minute, arrive promptly before Christmas. I am so impressed with Amazon's service. Thank you.

Name: Steven Spencer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 April 2021
Review Content: I'm really impressed with this Fire stick lite. I had a second gen which was perfectly usuable but after getting a new Amazon tablet I thought I'd upgrade my fire stick as well.I set it up using the remote control I already had so keeping tv controls.There are little reminders asking me to mention Stream Quality, Voice recognition and Akexa integration. So consider them mentioned. But on make serious note all of these functions are good.As the software is based on android 9 adding extra storage is so simple.So my dumb bedroom tv has gone from dumb to smart to very smart and I'm very happy.

Name: T. Bagge
Review Title: It’s inexpensive and unobtrusive and does its job very well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2020
Review Content: I already have a 1st Generation Firestick, a 2nd Gen Firestick, a Fire TV and a 4K Firestick.The Firestick Lite is the only one with OS7 which means you can, with the aid of an OTG cable, easily supplement its storage with additional USB storage. (You can do this, too, with the Firestick 4K but, because it has got only OS6, it’s more complicated.).The Firestick Lite is very responsive and, particularly as it’s inexpensive, is well worth getting.

Name: Ellie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2021
Review Content: I have a relatively old TV now, that doesn't support 4K, so I didn't see the point in paying extra for other firesticks. Plus, this was on a Black Friday deal and the others were sold out. The Lite does the job for me, works perfectly, very user friendly, and I like the fact that it gives you a ton of recommendations across all your downloaded apps in one place on the home screen (similar to what Netflix does). Have had a few connection issues, which I concluded have been down to our internet and not the firestick. My bedroom often gets patchy connection, and since I moved my smart speaker away from my TV, some of the issues have gone - which is one of the troubleshooting ideas that the firestick does suggest with connection issues (moving other wifi devices away).I like the fact that I can move it between TV's effortlessly if anyone wants to watch from certain streaming services - saves connecting the laptop via hdmi!

Name: Jcobbs
Review Title: Easy to use (FANTASTIC) FOR MOVIE LOVERS.👌
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2020
Review Content: (Fire stick) Movies and more.This fire stick is really good.I've had no issues at all with the picture quality ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Easy to use remote control.I purchased this for my best friend for a Christmas present🎁 🎄as I have already purchased one from Amazon for myself within the last 2 months ago. So I am able to give an honest review of this product.Outstanding value for money.I purchased my 2nd one in the xmas sales.£19.99. Previous price was £29.99If I can use the fire stick anyone can as I am not technical at all.Injoy!!! 👌😊⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Name: Tarquin99
Review Title: Simple to install and use - and very responsive
