Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2020
Review Content: This model doesn't come with TV volume control or other bells and whistles, but is very simple to install and use.  When first connected, it updated the software.  You then select which Apps you wish to install.  If you haven't already got an account (e.g. for BBC iPlayer) you will need to set one up.  It is responsive and with Alexa can be operated by voice.  As my TV is near my router, I bought the ethernet adaptor too, so I could plug it straight into the router rather than use wi-fi.  The stick's power supply then plugs into the adaptor instead of the stick itself.  My primary use is to access BBC iPlayer, though having Youtube and other channels is useful, as is being able to 'cast' from my PC to the TV via the stick.  So far, very pleased.

Name: dpoet
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 October 2020
Review Content: I love in a poor reception area for freeview, every time we get high pressure I lose most of my channels. For £29.99 this is brilliant I can get most of freeview on fire tv. I can also receive lots of other free services. If fire tv is on I can either use voice via remote or control via the remote on my HD8 tablet. I can just say "Alexa find me a good action film" to my echo dot, and resulting film choices appear on my fire tv.

Name: Paul
Review Title: Relatively easy set up, and im computer thick.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 November 2020
Review Content: Seeing as the first one just stopped working and tried all the  hints on the amazon forum and failed to get it working i bough a newer one, and it works ok, seemed to be easier to set up and launch, volume and mute on the R/C as well as mute and tv off and on.So many channels now available some paid for and a lot free, but it always asks do you want to purchase.For 20 quids well worth the money.

Name: Graham
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 December 2020
Review Content: We have a problem with our Fire stick lite which we don't have with our original fire stick bought a couple of years ago. To get it to work properly we have to unplug the router, wait about 30s, and then plug it in again. We may have to repeat this after an hour or so of watching a program. I have tried swapping it with the other fire stick in our other TV but the same thing happens. Very odd and a bit annoying.

Name: martyna_C
Review Title: waste or money, does what it wants
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2020
Review Content: I cant view home at all.  Alexa only does what i ask her to do sometimes...not every time. Cant access half the apps and it keeps says Internet connection issue but when i go to settings and try to see what the problem is, it says its connected and the connection is very good. No idea what is wrong with this cheap set but ive used few fire sticks and apple tv box before and never ever had any issues as such. Waste or money

Name: Clive Williams
Review Title: Excellent picture quality, flaky network connectivity.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021
Review Content: I was so impressed with the performance and picture quality that I decided to buy a 4k version for the living room.Only gripe is that I have to occasionally reboot my router as network throughput degrades over time (not the fault of the firestick). When the network is back, the firestick cannot reconnect to the network even though it detects it and reports it as healthy.The resolution is to restart the firestick via the UI or power reset it via the wall socket.The firmware was recently upgraded to the new UI, I hoped that it would resolve the issue; unfortunately the problem still presents on the upgraded software.This issue does not present on the 4k version.

Name: Mr. John A. Pendry
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 November 2020
Review Content: The instructions are adequate but sparse and you need to do a bit of thinking and experimenting but eventually it all comes together. Picture not quite as good as my Freesat input. I needed to boost the WiFi via an extender and add a converter to add an Ethernet cable, but it was pretty seamless. The remote is a bit flimsy and small and easily lost however it was all worth it for all the extras.

Name: Carl Buckingham
Review Title: Huge improvement performance over my original Fire Stick
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 October 2020
Review Content: Well worth the upgrade, my original fireTV stick sometimes lagged when scrolling through the home screen or launching apps (Netflix, PrimeVideo, PLEX etc.) but this has vanished with the latest version.I purchased the Lite version as I use a harmony remote to control my other AV devices and therefore there was no need for the TV control. If you have any Harmony remote, or other multi control remote I would opt for the cheaper version.

Name: Shekinah
Review Title: Just buy it you won't regret it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2021
Review Content: I can't really fault this little stick. I had a smart TV in my bedroom and wanted to be able to watch Hay U and amazon prime on a larger screen instead of my tablet. Its absolutely perfect, I'm no IT genius, but to set up is so easy, into a HDMI socket on your TV and USB port and bingo. That's it. My TV defaults to the fire stick and apart from the regular tersiary TV channels which I don't want to watch on that TV anyway,  its fine. I have 2 other TVs in the house with sky plus boxes so in my opinion this firestick would upgrade a very basic TV providing it had a HDMI outlet, to a smart one. Fire is my default now and has everything. Iplayer, youtube, Netflix, plus lots more I don't have time to watch, you get my drift. Best part is I paid £18 just before Christmas. I would recommend strongly, you cant lose.

Name: jonzy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2020
Review Content: After struggling for two years with a chrome cast which I used for my garage tv, I cracked after spending an hour trying to get the thing working. I thought I’d give the fire stick a go. It was as cheap and my expectations were modest. It arrived, dead easy to set up and boy is it a great little product. No more needing to cast from my phone - this product and remote does it all. I can access all my streaming sites easily and quickly and I look forward to going to the garage now for a quick workout. This has to be the best value product I’ve ever bought on Amazon. Brilliant. 6 stars! No downsides at all.

Name: Rose
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 March 2021
Review Content: I don’t normally review products after less than twenty four hours, but I already know this Fire Stick has changed my TV from okay to amazing. I have a Bush Smart TV which is decidedly “okay”. I wanted to add some more apps (like Disney +) ti pimp the TV a bit and a Fire Stick seemed like the best option. Great decision. The quality of the picture is really improved, the number of apps available is huge and my TV works more smoothly than it ever has. If you have a lower end smart TV and want more functionality I don’t think you can really go wrong with this Fire Stick.

Name: Jonny
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2021
Review Content: I purchased one of these for the upstairs TV that doesn't get masses of use, as such we purchased the lite version. The only difference between this and the normal is that there's no volume buttons on the remote.If you don't mind using 2 remotes (one for fire TV and one for volume) this is a good cheaper alterative.Picture quality is still great and voice recognition works well.Slight area of improvement would be the back of the remote where the batteries go. It can be a bit awkward to get off but not a major issue in the grand scale.

Name: Dr D J
Review Title: Unreliable network connectivity.  Otherwise it's good
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2020
Review Content: This is an clever little device and perfect for converting a small kitchen or bedroom TV into a smart TV.  However, my device keeps losing the network connection and internet, despite reporting in the Settings that the WiFi signal is strong.  When that happens there is no easy way to get it to reconnect.  Restarting doesn't help.  It's just a matter of chance.  If this continues I'll have to return it.

Name: Valleymatt
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 December 2020
Review Content: Easy set up, easy to use, great connectivity, great content, what more could you ask for? TV, movies, music, games and I can also ask Alexa to show display any one of my Blink cameras on my TV. Great for watching the foxes and other wildlife at night. I find the whole Alexa digital package so much better than Google. I know it’s each to their own, but for me, Alexa is way ahead in all areas. Top marks!

Name: Richard
Review Title: If it worked properly it would be great !
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 May 2021
Review Content: Had this for a few months now & am disappointed. Extremely temperamental, streaming quality is not great. I bought it for the Eurosport app as BT no longer have ES. Let me save you the bother, don't ! The Eurosport app is terrible, the streaming quality is at best patchy, often unwatchable. Other apps seem ok so I guess its' not the fire stick. However, having recently bought an Amazon ethernet adapter to try to solve picture quality issues, which at first seem to have made a difference, the Fire stick now has a habit of losing connection & freezing up or switching itself to wifi of it's own accord ! Constant unplugging, restarting, which doesn't work, all in all it's very frustrating. If it worked how you'd expect it would be great but most of the time it doesn't. Even had BT engineer out to check my line, router etc & it's all fine. Other devices connected to the same router have no issues. Maybe i'm just unlucky & have a duff one, maybe the Fire stick lite is not as good as the other models, who knows.

Name: MJ
Review Title: Absolutely brilliant, really easy to set up and use.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 March 2021
Review Content: Bought this for my mother to make her tv ‘smart’. Given she is not particularly tech savvy I was impressed with how easy it was for her to navigate. There is a really wide selection of integrated apps, way more than anyone would ever want. It’s reliable and there have been no streaming issues at all, picks up the wifi signal from another floor with ease. I cannot comment on the Alexa integration and voice commands as I feel teaching my mother to do that would be a step too far! However, I cannot recommend this enough - a fraction of the price of an Apple TV!

Name: Gadget Man Matt
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2021
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: caroline Adlard
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2021
Review Content: Hi ,I live in a poor internet area having changed to fibre things have improved so brought the firestick lite ,set up was easy however if my internet drops out (frequently in a village ) I have to remove from the TV and reinstall each time not so easy as it means getting behind the T.V.Also only put a programme on hold for a few seconds and seem to end up running through the entire menu to restart tbf that could deffo be me as tech not my strong point.My granddaughter loves daily Peppa Pig & watches repeats happily so worth it for that alone .

Name: Bob D
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 November 2020
Review Content: Bought this to try as a replacement for my 2nd gen firestick. I had been suffering constant drop-outs and buffering combined with too many manual resets when seeing the blank screen instead of the home screen. I had already tried a different broadband router with no improvement so when I saw this lite firestick at £19.99 I thought it was worth a try.  Turns out it is definitely better - quicker responses and, so far after a couple of days trial, no buffering and no blank screen so for me this purchase was a good one and I'll be keeping this firestick.

Name: Herts Brenda
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2021
Review Content: I do have a smart tv but wanted to have all APPS in one place for easy access and this has certainly been the case with the Amazon Fire TV stick. It was simplicity itself to install as the spare HDMI slot on my TV was on the side of the television rather than at the back! Keeping it charged simple too with plugged in cable close to power supply. Price was really good too, as purchased while on offer - so yes - very pleased with the quality/price and pleased too with the picture quality and sound. Not sure why I didn't purchase this item ages ago!!

Name: lyndylou
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 December 2020
Review Content: Was reluctant to purchase another ‘gadget’ but soooo glad I did. My old Samsung TV doesn’t support certain tv apps and now I can watch all of the tv channels I couldn’t get before and many more I didn’t know of. Can change channels etc using Alexa if I’m feeling really lazy. Only thing it doesn’t do that I can see so far is adjust the volume of tv, 1st world problem tho, LOL. Great value for money

Name: Andrew Sutherland
Review Title: Noticeably faster than my old fire stick
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2021
Review Content: Bought this to replace a 1st gen fire stick I'd had for 5 years, the navigation for which had become frustratingly slow and which really seemed to suffer when live streaming the football on Prime.  This new version is far zippier - it's much speedier generally but especially the app load times and, best of all, I'm noticing a much smoother streaming experience with no more lagging or buffering, even though it's located exactly where the previous stick was (I thought I'd maybe need to use an Ethernet connection, but it streams seamlessly without).

Name: JWF Mcilwraith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2020
Review Content: The product Amazon made whilst all their design staff were on holiday. Cheap and badly put together, poor quality plastics  with gaps galore. Reminiscent  of cheap Chinese knock-offs from a decade ago. A typical issue being the utterly pointless 2 inch "extension cable". What possible difference could that make to Wi-Fi reception?Amazon advertise this item as having "Everything you need, right out of the box", which isn't true as the unit comes with no batteries and with none of the software installed. So be prepared for a trip to the shops and very long wait whilst the tediously slow software installs.Apple TV 100x better than this, my Fire Stick on its way back to Amazon.

Name: Nick Wills
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 November 2020
Review Content: Much improved over the 2nd Generation Firestick.  Faster and easier to use.I added a 64g Flashdrive (which was not easy to do on the 2nd gen), removed the bloatware and added the apps I wanted onto the flashdrive, keeping the memory usage on the Firestick as low as possible.I force stop every App on closing and delete the cache, it runs like a dream.Bonus was it was only £20 in the Black Friday sale, but would still be worth the full £30 anyway.If you have an older Firestick it is well worth the upgrade and with a few tweaks you will have a beast of a streaming device.

Name: mule4468
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 April 2021
Review Content: Overall quality is good, though internet connection dependent.Alexa learns..... As the stick is location based (post/zip code) Alexa can answer local questions ie weather etc.Loads of apps - TV, film etc both on the app store and other sources.Value for money 100%Ideal for upgrading TV to a "smart" version and No aerial required, but an hd socket is necessary, so the majority of older TVs, the last 5 yes should be able to use it.Ideal for room with no aerial access.Amazon account is required though.

Name: Brian T
Review Title: Lot better than earlier versions, but not as good as the more expensive versions
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2021
Review Content: Great value for money and works well.Have purchased the Ultra HD and the one with TV controls as wellGiven the choice again, would definitely purchase the one with the TV controls for convivence or the ultra one for a faster response even if only using in HD.Why three? -Simply because the Firestick  gives a simple and consistent interface for streaming on the three TV's in the house replacing the built in ones with different interfaces  for each one  and poorly done to.Life is so much simpler now!

Name: Paul Woodcraft
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 October 2020
Review Content: I had an original Fire Stick, which was slowing & struggled to connect to WiFi. I decided to check the new Fire Stick. The Lite version met all my needs as I have a soundbar & didn't need the bells & whistles offered by the more expensive versions.All I can say it is a revelation; its connection is virtually instantaneous when making initial connections to Apps; it just works, which is brilliant.

Name: samantha weiss
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 March 2021
Review Content: Not yet integrated with Alexa, had it since Christmas, had to turn it off and on again 3 times as it stopped the sound, but that’s no biggie... voice recognition works most of the time, I wish there was a way to totally customise the Home Screen to continue watching being the first to pop up then the suggestions bellow, as I watched a 15 season program I kept having to find where I last was, as it kept sending me to other series of the same show but ahead of where I was...My point... it’s user friendly to someone who is tech oriented, and only ever known this tech... I couldn’t introduce someone tech scared to this... my qualm is more with it being not so user friendly to the minority I guess...perhaps the newer one is better... having it linked to control the tv it’s self like volume etc... I wouldn’t know

Name: mouseym
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 January 2021
Review Content: Bought this to replace my TV's built in smart features, however am returning it for the following;Home screen is a mess, large parts are dedicated to shows i have no interest in whereas the apps i am interested in are hidden away in a small menu denoted by 3 dots.No google play store is another huge problem, amazon's app store is limited, has no search functionality and uses really stupid categories which makes looking for things like a web browser a chore.I have a much better time just connecting my laptop to my TV and using that instead.

Name: Brian E
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 January 2021
Review Content: I bought it so when I'm away from home I have all my streaming and catch up services conveniently with me without logging in and out temporary accommodation's TV. Plus I got it for £17.99.Set up was easy but I'm quite good with tech.Good points.Pucture quality very good good for 1080p 60Hz on all for example Netflix and YouTube but poor on Sky news but I think it's a Sky issue. Amazon music audio quality is very good to me it sounds close to CD. A few bonuses my TV remote has a some functionality with the firestick and using voice commands it with play radio stations.Not so good points.The body of the firestick has a thickness which on some TV's may make it difficult to plug it into the HDMI fortunately there's a HDMI extender cable supplied for this purpose. Under some conditions when I'm doing something with the TV I lose the sound but the picture is find. I've investigated it and come to the conclusion the firestick stops transmitting the audio. To restore the audio just restart the firestick. I think there Is some incompatibility between the firestick and my Panasonic Smart Viera TV 2012 model TX-L42DT50B. It would be difficult to ensure the firestick was 100% compatible with all past TV's no matter how old they are.Overall I'm pleased with it. A good bit of kit well done Amazon.

Name: Cogs50
Review Title: Needs Firmware upgrade, to load none amazon apps via Downloader.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2020
Review Content: The Fire Stick Lite  is Aimed at the novice end of the Market. For someone who want to just plug in and play. If you want to download none amazon apps I would suggest buying the next versions up, 4K or the Alexa tv remote versions.  When loading apps via the downloader, It install the App but there are No Icons, just square boxes with a line through it.  Other than that, the picture & sound quality is very good. A future firmware upgrade may resolve the icon Problem.

Name: W.Spicer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 March 2021
Review Content: I bought the device because I've been viewing a lot of Amazon Prime movies and box sets during the pandemic but I've had to watch them on my lap top because my five year old SMART TV was unable to stream them.  The Fire Stick was super-easy to set up: basically plug the device into an HDMI port at the back of the TV plus five minutes of following on-screen instructions. It also works in my small bedroom TV which is not a SMART TV. Just remove the stick from the big TV and plug it into the little one for that to function as a SMART TV. Alexa does work but it's not really a feature that's pertinent to me. I asked it to find Liam Neeson films for me that were free to watch and it lined them all up. Clever stuff.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 February 2021
Review Content: Didn't buy it for voice control as Alexa doesn't like me. Easy to set up and use. Only downside is there is no off button so you have to leave it on and when you switch it on sometimes it has lost its connection to the internet. I don't know if it is the control itself or the internet. However all you have to do is go to settings and reset and everything comes back exactly as you left it. Not a big deal. It is very small so you have to make sure you put it somewhere you can find it easily or you could lose it down the side of the sofa.

Name: Rachel
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 April 2021
Review Content: Speaking to a remote? I didn't think I would, but I do. The small remote and easy set up, means this Fire Stick is set up within minutes.Plug the Fire Stick into the TV.Plug the Fire Stick into the mains.Put the batteries into the remote.Select the TV channel.Log in to you WiFi network.Go...There are plenty of apps available, in addition to Prime, so you can use the Fire Stick for BBC, ITV, Channels 4 and 5, plus many more.I would highly recommend.

Name: rodney meek
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2020
Review Content: Great device BUT DOLBY DIGITAL DOES NOT WORK unless you have the correct equipment,I couldn’t find a correct description or demonstration so I had to try then return.I have a Philips sound bar & Sony TV. It plays Dolby digital plus & 5.1.The fire stick lite would not play DD through my sounbar or TV. Tried every audio settings option.Went back to my older 2019 fire stick & that works perfectly. Dolby digital perfection.So unfortunately the LITE 2020 is no use for me.

Name: Mastwitch Spume
Review Title: From elderly flat screen TV to smart TV in seconds
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 November 2020
Review Content: Had been accessing TV apps by plugging laptop into elderly Sony Bravia flat screen TV, bit of a faff. £20.00 lighter in the wallet I now have a bang up to date smart TV. Fire TV Stick is simplicity itself to use, plug it into the HDMI socket and away you go. I can now access Prime, BBC I Player, ALL4, ITV Hub etc.. Very impressed.

Name: Mr Truth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 January 2021
Review Content: i only partake in amazon prime when offered as free trial for a month as i dont watch a lot of TV and there isnt much free content that appeals to me but so far i only watched on laptop or firehd tablet so i bought this usb for TV on offer at about £18 i think seeing as i dont subscribe thats fair enough to actually watch on TV . Also what is good though is that even though my JVC smart TV is only a few years old , the iPlayer app in it picture quality seems not that good and i think iPlayer app is actually badly designed  so this Amazon Fire TV stick solves this problem as the quality of all apps is perfect and high res ... personally I dont need 4K .. voice control seems to work but not used that much to be honest...hopefully the youtube and ipayer apps etc will still work when my prime trial ends.... it seems that apps in smart TV's always end up slowing down and dont update so this Firestick hopefully will allow apps to keep up to date ...

Name: Neil Cartwright
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2020
Review Content: Works great unless you want to watch live sport then it is totally useless. The picture lags, stutters jerks and pixelates. Not just slightly but absolutely massively.This is definitely due to the fire stick as the same programs work perfectly on the iPad connected to the same wireless point. In the end for live sport I have to stream from the iPad to the tv. Just tried watching the rugby highlights and whilst nowhere near as bad as the live stream, there is still jerkiness. Again fine on the iPad.

Name: Hector 52
Review Title: Needs good WiFi to operate properly !
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 April 2021
Review Content: I have been unable to make proper use of this firestick since I bought it due to the fact that my WiFi internet system via Virgin Media needs to be improved. The programmes that are available via the firestick seems to keep freezing all the time and I am unable to see a complete programme on my kitchen television which operates under "Freeview" and is not connected to the Virgin Media System. Once I get the WiFi system sorted out then I believe I will be able to make proper and full use of the firestick.

Name: Lee Fuller
Review Title: Does exactly what one would expect.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 February 2021
Review Content: The voice recognition was as per standard with Alexa, the picture quality is limited by the 1080 projector we plugged it into and is very good. The Alexa integration is also fine in that we can watch the ring door bell or ask the usual things one would ask of Alexa. We don’t use it as we have an echo in the room in any case.  We chose this unit due to knowing it would be going into a 1080 device so no need to pay the extra for the 4K likewise we didn’t feel the need to pay extra for TV control as we don’t really use the projectors control so thought it unlikely we would use the function on the fire tv stick remote.  The only negative in buying the is device was realising just how insanely bad our original fire stick (I think it was the first one released) is that we had been using on the projector prior to this, as such we will most likely buy a new stick for the playroom tv and recycle the old one!

Name: Koyel
Review Title: Great only one flaw which has now resolved
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 March 2021
Review Content: It’s a really good product but for the first few weeks there was an issue when switching over source to the stock there was no sound. To get sound then I would have to unplug from tv and cable to get sounds which was really annoying as everyday I would have to do this if I wanted to use the stick. However the last week this seems to have resolved itself which is ace as this was the only flaw I found. The voice is great and useful when feeling lazy. Stream quality is decent too. Would buy again for sure and do recommend.

Name: awd
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 December 2020
Review Content: I have the 4k Firestick and it is controlled by Alexa.I placed this Firestick in a different room group, called it a different name,  yet Alexa cannot contol this one,  even when using the Alexa from the room it is grouped in.  Only if you press the button on the remote will voice contol  work.This leads to a second issue,  if you use the voice search  whist watching Now Tv it causes the app to crash.If anyone at Amazon can explain why Alexa will not work with this and fix it I'll up the mark for the review.

Name: JackieK
Review Title: Very Impressive Streaming Device offering Quality Services and Value for Money
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2021
Review Content: I have not used a Firestick before and had no prior expectations.  However, it is truly amazing and brings together all the streaming services in one neat location.  It was simple to install and is easy to navigate, plus there are ample videos on Youtube offering guidance and advice to optimise available services and apps.  My only regret is that I did not purchase the Firestick that includes volume control.  I would have no hesitation in recommending this Firestick or similar upgrades to potential purchasers.

Name: Geoff
Review Title: Not compatible with Echo Plus or any Echo
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021
Review Content: I didn't read the print properly, this unit as a Lite isn't compatible with any of the Echo products, after plugging into my monitor not TV I realised my monitor didn't have speakers, then tried to connect to my Echo plus, after doing some research I found out that I needed the 4K unit, twice the price but then you get what you pay for, to sum up, if you have a TV  and just want to plug and play then this is the unit for you, if you need to connect to other devices for sound then you need to go for the more expensive unit.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Wow 🤩 wow 🥳 best piece of electronics ever & for a bargain price 👏🤑
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 March 2021
Review Content: Wow this is amazing, so pleased I bought this for my older style TV, it was so easy to install. Just plug & go into the hdmi socket on my telly, then switch to hdmi setting and add my Wi-fi code voila 😃 1 smart tv for the cost of £29.99, I can even access my Bluetooth speaker now and just turn the TV volume down to 0. Thank-you Amazon yet again for saving the day. All the Apps you could think of including Netflix and the remote also works on Alexa so you can voice activate your TV 🥳🥳

Name: Viktor Stevich
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2021
Review Content: 5 stars from me.The reason I bought this is that I had apple TV version 3 and they have stopped the "you tube" service and they have informed me that they do not support it anymore, it is better for me to buy Apple TV 4.Instead, I bought an amazon fire stick for 1/6 of the apple TV price which literally has much more options than the over expensive apple TV.It is easy to install, easy to use and worse perfect with Alexa ECHO.I am very happy with this purchase

Name: Webazon
Review Title: Second Firestick which works as expected
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2021
Review Content: When you have existing tvs and installations this is such an easy way to get netflix, amazon prime etc.  It is our second firestick and they both work really well.Getting Amazon Music to realise not to play on the alexa is a challenge!  But it all works very reliably otherwise.If there was a niggle it would be with the app writers rather than Amazon Firestick itself.  E.g.Sky news - used all the time - but no pause facility (useful when the calls come inBBC iPlayer - increasingly less reliable app - programmes (e.g. news) take ages before they are available and the app often crashesDeezer - simply not an option if you use Amazon firestick because it times out after 20 mins or so.  Really poor implementationAmazon Prime - difficult to navigate and remember what you are part way through watching compared with Netflix which has this facility sorted perfectly.Amazon Music - really not anywhere near as well organised as Deezer or Spotify but given they are a newer entrant it works well and we do use it (because Deezer is useless on Firesticks)I am rambling but the bluetooth connection on Firestick Lite HD works really well for connecting to BT headphones or most speakers - but it does not fall back to 2.1 in full stereo properly if you want to connect to BT PA equipment which tends to use older BT standards.  The older Firsetick does work properly.Having said all this it is amazing value for money and does pretty much all you need very reliably and neatly.

Name: Mr J.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 January 2021
Review Content: The missus was a slave to costly TV subscriptions and 'the planner' whether it was Sky, EE, Virgin or BT - having the schedule and reminders was a must have - we solved this with a firestick and a radio times subscription. I opted for this version as I thought an extra 10 bucks for a 'tv volume control button' was a bit steep however that is my only regret, within 10 minutes I wished I had that button. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this sticks performance, worked straight out of the box already linked to my account. So why the 4 stars? it loses a star as the battery cover isn't as tight as can be and squeaks whilst using it, feeling slightly cheap.

Name: Mr. G. Webb
Review Title: A great little device that has exceeded my expectations
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2021
Review Content: Really simple to setup after an initial glitch trying to connect to my WiFi. In fact it was mildly alarming just how much Amazon managed to preconfigure with all the data it has stashed away on me already! I'm using this to feed into a 1080p apeman projector I recently picked up, far easier than routing great long cables about. The device itself is very easy to use, and the interface is great. For less than £20 this is a fantastic bit of kit and I'm really pleased with it.

Name: Paul
Review Title: Poor quality RC BUT the Firestick is great.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 December 2020
Review Content: The RC only gets 3 stars because of quality. Compared to the 2nd Gen firestick this one is more flimsy. We notice that when we go to pause a movie or whatever the RC flexes in your hand. As this was an upgrade from our 2nd Gen firestick (I gave that one to my mum) there really is a feeling of less rigidity Andover quality. A shame. We also have the 4K Firestick and it's RC is definitely made better.The lite Firestick itself is great and does what it says on the tin.

Name: happy puppy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2020
Review Content: Used this to update a non smart Panasonic plasma TV.  It works well does everything i so far need it to do.  I've only rated the video quality as 4 stars as I've not tested it at anything other than 720p which it does well. So I cannot comment on higher resolutions.  Not found I needed the volume controls on the remote, as you can adjust it with the TV remote. Alex as always struggles with ascents, unless East-ender-Essex. and really struggles with received pronunciation.

Name: Margaret
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2021
Review Content: I was happily using my Firestick for normal streaming, watching The Crown and Friends on Netflix, when all of a sudden one time the screen was blank, and none of the remote buttons could change that!! All I had was a voice-activation function - nothing else! I eventually got the voice to show me Netflix, but when the programme was over, it didn’t return to normal, it just went back to the black screen! And now even the voice won’t work!  Can anyone help? Most advice online involves going in to Settings, but I can’t do that as there’s nothing at all on my screen, so nothing to navigate to, and no means of navigating!I’ve only had it for about a month.  Hoping someone sees this and can help me!

Name: A. R.W
Review Title: Brings an old TV back to life for streaming channels
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 March 2021
Review Content: My 10 year old TV has plenty of HDMI sockets but very limited internet capability. The Fire TV Stick Lite has opened up a huge amount of content. To date just using for Prime, BBC, ITV, Channel 4 catchup services.  Watching videos on YouTube it seems that it can be configured to connect to a lot more content, that's something for a rainy day. At the moment just content in watching movies on Prime and deciding on whether I really need a TV license any more if all I plan on watching is catch-up and no BBC iPlayer content.

Name: Lisa
Review Title: Works great, perfect streaming and clear picture
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 November 2020
Review Content: I had the original Amazon Fire Stick but it started lagging and crashing a lot when I was watching videos. This newer Fire Stick is so much more superior. It set itself up in minutes using the Wifi info from my previous stick so I didn’t have to Put the passwords in again. It is also far far faster, with no lag and the picture quality is a lot better. I’m still getting used to the Voice activated function on it but it’s fun to try it. I wish I’d Upgrades ages ago.

Name: Fir3mansam123
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2020
Review Content: Excellent upgrade to my 1st generation stick which was slow laggy and very unresponsive.This one is quick load up on playing no buffer wait and is responsive.Also unlike my 1st gen, you can add external storage and ethernet connection if you wish to which makes it a fully functional media centre.I don't have a 4k TV so this is perfect for me.And best of all its currently only £19.99 £10 cheaper than the normal price.

Name: Sof
Review Title: Simple to install and use, and inexpensice
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 April 2021
Review Content: I bought this after a complete fail at getting a Google Chromecast to work. How different this was. Installed it in an HDMI port on the side of my TV, easily connected to passworded wifi, no faffing with a phone (which is required with the Chromecast). Just a simple little remote control that needs little learning to operate. You press a button to speak commands, so you don't feel listened to all the time.Once you've logged in on set up to all your favourite servies (mine are Netflix, iPlayer, BBC Sounds, YouTube, Amazon Prime, etc), you can ask it to play or continue something via a simple voice command and it finds it on whatever service, so you don't have to remember which service it was on.An extra feature I would like is a list of what I've recently been watching on any streaming services. This does not yet appear to be available, only within them.

Name: katy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 March 2021
Review Content: Loved the fact this time it asked if I wanted to download or sync my previously purchased apps so I didn’t have to do each one individually again. This is my 4th firestick, they keep breaking, I’ve got a tv that goes up and down in the bed and the lead keeps getting caught up so have had to keep replacing them. I couldn’t be without one, my make of tv, although a smart tv you can only have the apps they have, had no idea when I purchased it that there was such a poor choice

Name: Terri webb
Review Title: Works well without having to buy a smart tv
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2020
Review Content: Great little product, bought for the spare tv instead of buying a smart tv. Downloaded tv player so has normal freeview and works fine on iplayer ect. Our main amzon dot controls it well if we want it to Or can use alexa on the remote. Wish I had got the one with the volume control on now but that's just down to ease of use Overall pleased

Name: Chester
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2021
Review Content: Excellent addition. I mainly bought it to have UFC fight pass on my TV, but having all of the extra and staple entertainment apps really helps.It’s easy to set up and its a convenient size so you can easily plug it into any TV with a HDMI and USB port. I use it in both TVs in my house (24in & 55in) and the quality is great on both.I would recommend to anyone who wants to have and updated smart TV experience without having to buy a new TV.

Name: Josh
Review Title: Very small and very capable little device!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 April 2021
Review Content: They really are great little devices its a shock how they offer them for so cheap cause there better than any streaming box ive had and its just unreal how small and capable they are, i have my prime video and alexa and amazon music all on there ready to use and downloaded netflix and youtube and some cool apps such as vlc player so i can watch my movies on theres also some great free games like beach buggy racing and crossy roads that my son loves. Theres also hangman/ picture quiz, and gta3/vice city avalable for 2.99 each! but id stress you get a cheap 4gb usb drive or somethin to send your apps to, you will also need an otg cable to be able to connect it cause any of the gtas will use every bit of space up on the firestick lite. Just cant believe ive waitin so long to get one im quite into tech and a big gamer this device really has impressed me especially for its price point 29.99!  would highly reccomend a firestick for anyones house. Now a prime member, a firestick user, an alexa user, and i even have the lightbulb! what next?

Name: David W
Review Title: Fast Wi-Fi and apps boot up very quickly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 January 2021
Review Content: It took a while to get the product set up. The Panasonic TV port kept timing out and I did not get to finish typing in a password. Eventually set yup the system on a basic system with no timeout.Good Wi-Fi capability. Boots up apps very quickly.Now works fine on the Panasonic. So in all a good product that will replace some of the older "smart" items we have with power Wi-Fi and processing power.We do not have Alexa.Recommended.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 March 2021
Review Content: Bought this firestick to replaced an older one that was grinding to a halt as a result of updates I suspect it was never designed to process - but kept running all the same. The comparison is night and day, the new firestick is much faster in operation, the streaming is excellent and the picture upscaling noticeable, the audio too seems to be improved. I had intended to wait until the 'new generation' standard firestick came down in price but why bother when the 'Lite' version so convincingly covers all the bases. Money well spent, would highly recommend.

Name: Ms. M. Leask
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 April 2021
Review Content: This new Fire Stick is working very well with no problems whatsoever.  Not being able to control the tv with it does not present any difficulty.  It was time consuming to have to register with BBC I Player, Netflix, STV etc. all over again.  I thought it would just carry on where my previous Fire stick left off but that is really just a minor detail.  As long as it keeps working as well as it is at present I shall be very happy with my purchase.

Name: Stephen J Bannister
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2021
Review Content: Excellent value for money, my partner and I have cancelled our subscription  TV package and just gone with prime, there is a lot more on there than you would think! Combined with some other apps, it has everything you need!However, frustratingly it doesn't seem to work occasionally. There is no way to close the system down aside from putting it to "sleep", and often I find the next time I use it I need to unplug it from the wall and plug it back in again, which is super inconvenient to climb around the back of my setup. Other than this, excellent value and not the worst thing to have to do for a workaround.

Name: Matt Walker-Wilson
Review Title: Very easy to set up.  And oces et up, it works like a dream.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021
Review Content: Easy access to our Netflix, account. Plus iPlayer, ITV Hub and Channel 4. And YouTube for all he exercise videos.  Amazon Music is a revelation.  Never even realised there was such a thing. And easy to use.  Press the "mic" button on the remote, say "play Barry White"  and bingo - endless Barry White playlists. Would be absolutely brilliant for blind people or people with other limitations.  We don't have an Alexa dot or echo, so can't tell you how that work.  The voice command recognition built into the Firestick, works very well with our ordinary English (Northern and London) accents.

Name: Becky Rose
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2021
Review Content: Since cancelling Sky TV, we were looking for a device which would allow us to watch catch-up tv on our 2014 Panasonic - although it is still a great TV, it doesn't have as many smart features as the newer models. This Fire Stick is great for that - it's lightweight, the picture and sound are brilliant (arguably better than Sky) and crucially it's easier to use. Love the fact that all of our apps are integrated (Disney+/Netflix). Very good value!

Name: M. R.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 November 2020
Review Content: One star knocked off for a bunch of updates at startup.-and for it not being linked to my Amazon account despite me enabling that option while purchasing it.Other than that... I just wanted something cheap to play games via Moonlight Game Streaming, with the occasional bit of YouTube, twitch, etc. I don't really watch 'tv' a whole lot.The latency could be better for Moonlight; I plan to get an ethernet adapter later and see if that helps. Besides that, it's perfect for what I need.

Name: Anita W.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2020
Review Content: i mainly bought this firestick for my 3 grandkids to use so they don't use my 4k firestick lol... and i'm very impressed with it...but i really do think Amazon needs to do something about a game controller....alot of amazon games require a game controller, which amazon now have no official one available...but a few times i've gone on chat and asked for advice on a compatible one and been given different answers, and twitter as given a different answer too. This really isn't good enough, amazon sells 1000's of the firesticks, cubes etc so surely a tried and tested list for customers isn't too much to ask....who can afford a £40 game controller that only "might" work... well i've bit the bullet and send for a game controller for my grandkids and just hope it works....

Name: Adzmaz
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 April 2021
Review Content: While the stick itself when working is quite good, it has room for improvement.When I have used it and put it in sleep mode, I'll come back and it will say no signal, which then means 20 minutes of testing signal, signal saying full signal but still wont connect, then you have to re start the stick again, then eventually it will connect.Also certain apps aren't available which is poor.Not connected to alexa or used voice recognition.

Name: Jekaterina
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 January 2021
Review Content: Amazing device.  100% recommended from me. I have TV that is 9 years old. It still work perfectly but not smart TV. So I have used my laptop with TV to watch Netflix and amazon prime video. But after I've got fire stick I no need my laptop anymore near TV. Now my not smart TV works like a smart TV. Fire stick have YouTube, Internet browser, Netflix, amazon prime video, that is everything I need to have on my TV. Fire stick very small and save me a lot of space near TV. I followed guide which I've got in box to install everything and it takes me 5-10 minutes.I'm love that device have parental control, so I'm sure that my kids watching only what they allowed.Very easy to use, remote is very small and no need space for another huge remote.I'm love it.

Name: FionaMorganHauser
Review Title: Converts tv to Smart tv ,a really good purchase for lockdown!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 March 2021
Review Content: One very happy lady!Finally converted new tv into a Smart Tv after much hassle with slow laptop hdmi cable failing to deliver am now up and running with some help from my carer ! The hdmi adaptor makes life so much easier as i cant get the cable in the back of tv without struggling due to arthritus .  Very happy to have access to Netflix can now watch Free Rein which helps in lockdown due to not going out much , and Lark rise to candleford series vampire diaries etc etc on Prime video which are also paid for already! watched Free Rein season one and onto the Waltons at the moment ,im thick at technology this was easy to sort . only moan is that it rejected my working password for my e mail address and keeps doing that but that was soon sorted out  .Fine for rest of lockdown able to have a screen break as small screens giving me a headache ! very happy and would recommend as a good purchase .

Name: The Girl With the Plants and Books!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020

Name: SixtyOne
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2020
Review Content: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2020

Name: CB
Review Title: Great for access to apps on your TV
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 March 2021
Review Content: I bought this to get apps like BBC iPlayer and Netflix on my non-smart TV. It's really simple to set up (takes a matter of minutes) and download the apps you want. Streaming is fast, which is an improvement on the previous version which was buggy and slow. I'm very happy with this purchase and the novelty of the voice recognition is still quite fun. The remote doesn't have volume control but this doesn't really matter to me. The device plugs into the back of my TV in the HDMI port easily, although there is also an extender provided if plug-in space is an issue. The range of apps is excellent and it is easy to rearrange or delete them.

Name: Stevie G
Review Title: This stick has fire-d me up!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 January 2021
Review Content: I bought this stick primarily to receive Apple TV on my TV. I was sceptical if it would do this and was ready to send it back it it didn't. I was very pleased to see that it worked and that it worked really well. It was a breeze to set up and navigate through. The picture quality is true HD and Alexa works well. I can't think of anything negative to say about it. I bought it when it was on offer so it's even more value for money!

Name: Margaret Chm
Review Title: Good device if you already have Prime
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020
Review Content: Bought this in order to watch rugby as Amazon got rights to Autumn Nations Cup. We have family Prime membership which means no extra expenditure, otherwise wouldn’t have bought it. I have most of the TV I want, but may well use it to watch films that I can’t get elsewhere. Setting up was very easy and picture quality generally good though some breaks in streaming, though that may be our broadband. Shan’t use Alexa, so can’t comment on that.

Name: pgo
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 December 2020
Review Content: I had to return a Roku Stick (useless). What I wanted was BBC iPlayer and the streaming services from ITV and Channels 4 and 5 (for a 10 year old Sony TV). And that is what I've got. It was easy to set up and I am content. Far fewer apps than Roku (and some looked promising), but they were all Yank ... and that means a lot of rubbish.Yes. I recommend the Fire Stick lite. But I really don't need Alexa ... Amazon's 'spy'.

Name: Rob Jones
Review Title: Hiccup on installation update but got there in the end
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 December 2020
Review Content: Upgraded from a first gen Firestick as needed a second and the price reduction in November seemed well worth taking advantage of.  Installation was trickier than anticipated as encountered error code 8056 which prevented streaming live sport.  It's an updating error and therefore 4 instead of 5 stars for this review.  I found that a factory reset was needed and, for me, the update seemed to hang at about 80% through but eventually (waiting 20 minutes) it completed and this sorted it all out.  The voice control through Alexa is very good, reducing time to navigate around the apps and searching for programmes.

Name: David R.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2021
Review Content: I didn't realise what a Fire TV stick actually did in spite of the adverts. When I had trouble with the smart hub on my eight-year-old TV being so slow, not able to display streamed broadcasts, and failed to have a YouTube app, I was advised by a family member to get a Fire TV stick. I should have done it ages ago because now I have a complete replacement for my built-in smart hub so I don't need to buy a new television set.

Name: Joanne
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2021
Review Content: This was on offer (£20) so we thought yeah why not give it a go.  Only problems - Always seems to be a synchronisation problem with sound and video - sound is often a few seconds behind pictures... only seems to happen when watching things with the fire stick. On iPad, phone etc all is synched.  It’s weird, sometimes sorted by ff or rwd.  But using Alexa to search is great - amusing at times too - we put this down to hubby’s regional accent!

Name: CJAD93
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2021
Review Content: So far I've really enjoyed my fire stick. Has a great range of apps and content. It's cheap, does a good job. Issues I have with mine are:1. When put into sleep mode I cannot turn the fire stick back on with the remote, I have to completely switch it off at the wall and back on.2. A sleep timer on the device would be really helpful, I have mine on at night whilr falling asleep, so having no sleep timer is a bit disappointing.Other than theres 2 issues which are both power related I really enjoy my fire stick.

Name: frostar
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 January 2021
Review Content: I got this as a backup stick during Black Friday discounts - was a steal . . .It has all the functionality of the previous Firestick but with latest processor and memory, more of a Standard Stick than a Lite version!!  If like me you don't require basic TV controls on the remote why pay the extra for that?  I question the requirement for a 4K version, as who has a 4k TV that isn't a Smart TV with Amazon already on it?A slightly worry thing is that the new stick logged on to my WIFI without the need to enter the security code because I already had a Firestick . . .  a hackers paradise??

Name: Ms Beeby
Review Title: Does what I wanted to do minimum fuss
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 December 2020
Review Content: Plugged this into a HDMI port using the handy extender. Simple set up to follow didnt have to put in passwords as already have alexa in situ.  Wanted this to use Amazon prime as no ariel in my bedroom and just wanted to watch as unwell.  Worked really well good picture, you can add other apps such as BBC Iplayer or Netflix etc but with additional cost ...didnt bother although did add my amazon music.  Did what I wanted. Turns any TV into smart TV

Name: O
Review Title: Does what it says on the tin
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 January 2021
Review Content: Other than the power supply issue.. this product is great for the price and basically makes your non-smart TV ‘smart’. Alexa’s voice recognition is the most seamless of the lot; although of course the Fire Stick can’t substitute for an Echo.Would be nice for a product that could combine both. A smart speaker and a streaming device. Not sure if there is already such a device and I’m just ignorant. Possibly Apple TV but that’s much pricier; Siri is no match for Alexa.The ‘power supply issue’ is the fiddly-ness of having to run a usb power cable to the stick when it’s plugged into a HDMI port (even with the extension).Of course there is the dongle that draws power from another USB port on your TV (if available). But this adds to the cost and more important is still fiddly! Two ports used up and still messy cables, albeit shorter.Does HDMI not allow sufficient power to be drawn from the HDMI port itself? If not they should consider that; of course I guess that would make it more a competitor to USB (data port) than an audio/visual port. Which I suppose is not something the relevant authorities want to pursue...Anyway.. if you have a ‘dumb’ TV - this product is top-notch.

Name: bevlah
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2021
Review Content: I bought the Firestick on a whim after reading a few reviews and have to say I'm really pleased with it.  I was a bit apprehensive it wouldn't work as I got it for my TV in bedroom and Internet connection is a bit hit and miss in there.  But it's absolutely brilliant.  Super easy to set up,  works a treat.  I only really got it to watch Amazon movies in bed but I know it can do so much more that I've yet to discover.  Great little device for £17 !

Name: corinne morgan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: Really pleased with the Amazon lite, bought it for my grandson, he has a TV in his room that he never used much, now he enjoys watching you tube, and prime videos which we got on trial and purchase monthly now, as there are so many benefits to having the subscription. The voice recognition works a treat, and it is easy to navigate around the menu, yes some channels you do have to subscribe, however really pleased with this product, you get a lot of value and use, it even comes with battery's and its own adapter to fit most TV,s which is a plus, easy to set up, one of the best things I have bought.

Name: E B
Review Title: New screen layout, great picture quality.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 January 2021
Review Content: This fire stick has a new format on screen and the new layout is much better than my 6 year old fire stick (which this is replacing).As ever fast delivery and worked straight out of the box, even recognising my wifi from my Amazon fire tv account. The picture quality is excellent and the selection from app to app on the remote is very quick and smooth. This new fire stick is a massive improvement on my old one.

Name: MOJOTAMWO
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2021
Review Content: I bought the Fire Stick to allow me to watch Netflix & Prime on a old non-smart TV. This has been totally successful and has also unexpectedly added many more obscure “free” channels. Installation and set up is relatively easy. A short cable is included in the box that enables the stick to hang down rather than protrude straight out of the back of the TV.  Switching from Terrestrial and Satellite TV services  to Fire is slightly complicated, but is a minor inconvenience for the benefits gained.  It’s too soon in my ownership to make any comments about the product’s longevity but, apart from that, I would 100% recommend this product.

Name: Kenny
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2020
Review Content: Had an original firestick for years but it was becoming increasingly slow and had minimal memory. Got the new one as I have recently moved house and this is great. Easy to set up and add the apps I had on my old device plus a few more as bigger storage. Decided to get the lite version as the additional £10 for the other model just let’s you turn you TV on/off and adjust volume but I already have the TV remote that does that!

Name: W. Peter Graham
Review Title: A source of limitless entertainment and information
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 March 2021
Review Content: I was experiencing some difficulty in accessing iPlayer and other services, until I discovered that they were no longer available on my 7 year old Sony TV.One of my family recommended the Firestick and I duly ordered one and it was available for collection within 48 hours.The Fire TV Stick Lite with Alexa Voice Remote Lite arrived with clear and easy to understand instructions on installation.  It can take some time to register with the various streaming services available, but this has only to be done once and future connections are very straightforward.The Alexa feature has already proved useful, bringing up a movie from 1992 which I wished to view.

Name: jacqueline mason
Review Title: Its a great addition to any TV
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 October 2020
Review Content: Easy to install and comes with Alexa voice control for when your feeling lazy just say the film name and it will come up if it is available. You can add any apps you want. You can login to any accounts you have already like Netflix, Amazon Prime etc but your tv will need more than one HDMI port if you have Sky or anything already using your HDMI port/s. It works a treat.

Name: Chuckdoodles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2021
Review Content: I had been so fed up with my Samsung Smart TV interface. It was laggy and slow to respond. I was at a mates house and he has a fire stick and was seamlessly zipping through his various streaming apps. So I decided to get the fire stick lite, and it's amazing. It was a bit of a pain to have to log into all my apps again but once that's done its fantastic. Voice search works well, especially when I've had a glass of wine or 2 and decide to call out random music videos to play on YouTube. It's so simple, fast and effective. I'm very happy.

Name: J. Roberts
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 January 2021
Review Content: I replaced an older version of my Fire Stick with this one.  Looked carefully at the other versions but didn't need extras (eg volume). Out of the box and installed in minutes.  Works every time, my old version is now working great upstairs but didn't downstairs nearer to the hub.I have used Alexa a couple of times successfully.  I haven't yet really delved into the this new fire stick.  I've got standard stuff loaded and happy with that.  I am now able to get you tube making me necessary exercises better than on my smart phone!

Name: D. Daniels
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021
Review Content: It was easy to initially set up the fire stick. I did not find it so easy to set up BBC I player or the ITV hub. In fact I still haven’t got the ITV hub working. After three weeks of really enjoying catching up on BBC programs the fire stick refused to find ‘home’. Switching off at the mains seemed to restore functionality. I will be happy once I have got ITV hub working. Impressed with the voice control.

Name: Kerry Thomson
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 December 2020
Review Content: Having been begged to buy Disney bloody plus I was very annoyed and disappointed to find that if you have a Panasonic TV it wont work. Also, you may have Sky but you have to have Sky Plus, if you don't you cant have it either!!! So having spoken to the nice man who sold me the Panasonic TV's I was advised to buy a fire stick. All the technology is not making my life easier! Another drama I could live without!

Name: Susan Montgomerie
Review Title: Simple catch up tv for old TVs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 November 2020
Review Content: As a complete novice to voice control and catch-up tv, it was relatively easy to install and sign up to all the apps. My 12 year old “dumb” tv now has bbc iPlayer, all4, my5, STV player, itv hub, YouTube, uktv play, all free streaming services. So, new telly, for a small price! The picture quality is good considering the age of the tv and the remote control is simple to use. All in all, I’m very happy with this purchase.

Name: Sassoon
Review Title: Suprisingly a small device that does a lot at a very good quality.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 March 2021
Review Content: I bought this device as a second streaming device for my bedroom for my non-smart tv. It changed the watching experience to a totally new level. It has all the main streaming options such as Netflix, Disney, BBC, and a lot more. The Amazon streaming is also great. Some apps need to be downloaded before use. The quality of the streaming is great. I would highly recommend this device even if you have a smart tv, it is so easy to use.

Name: Miss Kitty
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 November 2020
Review Content: I have a chronic illness and spend a lot of time in or on my bed. I have amazon unlimited music on my phone but wanted to have it on my tv. After doing a bit of research I found this and I’m really happy with it. Set up was easy as you’re given all the steps to follow on your screen. Now listening to Duran Duran via my fire stick and very happy!!Very cheap for an impressive piece of kit. I’d certainly recommend.

Name: Dan
Review Title: Turned my dumb TV into a Smart TV!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 March 2021
Review Content: After having issues streaming on an old LG smart TV we decided to get a Fire TV stick. Straight out of the box, it was easy to set up and the stream quality was superb. You can boost the strength of the receiver if you need to with an attachment that is included. It’s easy to set up your Netflix account, Spotify and other subscription services as well as BBC iplayer and so forth. For the price, it is superb and the remote is compact, robust and easy to use. It has proved to be an inexpensive and functional upgrade to our otherwise perfectly functional TV.

Name: LYNDA K
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 February 2021
Review Content: Bought this as a replacement for my 3 year old Fire TV stick which stopped working. Easy and fast setup. I don't use voice control a lot but it seems to work well, The new Fire stick can get Brit box, Apple TV and Discovery+ apps which my smart TV doesn't have. The apps load much faster and better home screen layout on the new device. The only annoyance sometimes is when launching Discovery+, often it doesn't load - just get a blank grey screen but going through the settings menu to 'restart device' does the trick.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 April 2021
Review Content: Was not sure about this release but now having had it for a while can honestly say impressed with this firestick. Performs just as as well my 4k firestick but obviously only in 1080p but as this was for upstairs so not a problem.Anybody wanting to upgrade from the old 2nd gen firestick highly recommended.Just waiting for amazon to release a new 4k firestick but to be honest my 4k firestick has served me well for for a few years now.You cannot go wrong with firesticks love em.

Name: Claire
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2021
Review Content: Purchased this to replace my old one and I’m very happy with it. The home layout is much easier to use and looks good too which is a bonus. Alexa can still get a bit confused bless her, I think that’s probably to be expected seeing as this is a fire stick and not an actual home hub. Speed of actions is great although this may depend on your internet connection I guess. Overall it’s pretty perfect. No volume controls for tv on this fire stick which I prefer, there is a more expensive version with tv volume control, I just didn’t see the point.

Name: Mr John Ryder
Review Title: Screensaver does not really function properly
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 February 2021
Review Content: I bought this so that I could use the screensaver function on shuffle, and access all my photos stored on the Amazon Photos App. As the screen kept going black after a short time, repeated (7 or 8) discussions with Amazon helpline technical experts could not solve the problem, until one more knowledgeable guy finally admitted that the screen saver had a built-in function that switched to sleep mode after 14 minutes, and there was nothing I could do about it. This was after all the advice I took from experts with Amazon and Currys to the contrary.So, if you want to use it to look at random photos, don't waste your money.

Name: S. P.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 November 2020
Review Content: This is so straightforward, so easy to set up. Plug in, it sets-up by itself,  updates then you are ready to rock 'n roll. Only took under 10 minutes. Brilliant, now I can enjoy Amazing movies on Prime. Thank you Amazon, you are awesome as always.

Name: Marcus Taylor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2021
Review Content: OMG this is soooooo amazing and soooo useful i can watch literally everything on here🌈❤️😍Everyone should have one of these❤️and i really love the design of the home screen❤️sooo beautiful and perfect💖💖And when you are idle for a while it play's beautiful slideshow of breathtaking landscapes💜Amazon Fire. Is literally a masterpiece❤️💜Thank you soooo much😍

Name: Dee Cee 1970
Review Title: Brilliant upgrade on my existing Fire stick..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 April 2021
Review Content: This was an upgrade on my existing Fire stick and it doesn't disappoint.Set up was quick and easy and it automatically loaded my existing apps.This model connects much faster than my basic model and streaming is smooth.This is actually my first Alexa product and so far, she has selected what I've requested first time and made sensible choices for my other less specific searches.I'd definitely recommend this upgrade if you're still using the basic Fire stick and it's really well priced.

Name: Lemonhunny
Review Title: If you don't have on, get one!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 April 2021
Review Content: Frankly, it's quite possibly the best investment I've made as regards TV!I've had Netflix & Disney+, but the Firestick is giving me all the TV shows I didn't see first time round, plus following a soap from the 80's which I remember watching back then.My only regret is that I didn't get the Firestick in March2020 when my business was shut for 3 months and we were in Lockdown 1!

Name: Mr. R. Burton
Review Title: Better for streaming than many "Smart" TV's
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 March 2021
Review Content: The unit does what it says. A little setting up is required for each service (the usual User Name Password etc.). Once this is done it is easy and simple to use, controls (pause, fast forward rewind) work well. The voice search feature is effective. The unit does try to upsell streaming services if you don't go straight to your chosen catch up channel, but subscription services are well flagged.

Name: Lizzy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2020
Review Content: I love this .I can watch live TV and you tube which is the main reason I bought this BUT it's SO MUCH BETTER THAN THAT.  I can just say ALEXA please find me x on you tube and its found so easily.  Its particularly great because I am not very techno and it saves me the trouble of trying to find it myself, PLUS I bought this in tne sale so it was only £19.99. Big win as far as I'm concerned Thank you .

Name: Nippier
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 December 2020
Review Content: I really love this product bought mainly because the BBC I Player was taken off my TV.  I managed to fit it myself and am getting used to the different facilities it gives.  There is absolutely nothing to dislike about it and I would recommend it to anyone. It has given me much more than just the BBC I Player and I am gradually discovering different videos to watch.  An excellent Amazon product.

Name: CazzyBuy
Review Title: I don't use Alexa but you do not have to with this at all...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 March 2021
Review Content: I was worried that this may need for me to use Alexa - I looked up in forums and I was almost sure I would be okay so ordered it.  I was pleased it did not ask or require me to use with Alexa installed as I do not use that.  It works fine and was easy to install.  This was my first upgrade from the original version  bought back in the day and thought the newer version be better than that now.

Name: Sheene1976
Review Title: If you have Sky Q, don't bother
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 January 2021
Review Content: Bought it to watch the Autum nations rugby as my Sharp TV app was hopeless. Plugged it in along with the separate power supply (once fully charged) and worked straight away. Juddered a couple of times but once I dropped the screen resolution, it worked spot onHowever, as the title suggests, if you have Sky Q you don't need to buy this as it's now one of the apps on the homescreen.

Name: Wendy B
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2021
Review Content: Was sent the Firestick by Racing TV as they no longer supporting the television channel on Freeview.  This now means that I can still watching the racing on my television via their app rather than casting it from my phone. Overall really pleased.  Easy to install the via stick on the television.  The app works well and the picture quality is very good.  Alexa is very responsive.  And my daughters are happy as they have been able to upload their Spotify accounts as well.  YouTube also works on it really well too.  Highly recommend it especially if you haven't got a smart  tv.

Name: TWM
Review Title: Do not purchase this sub standard product
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 April 2021
Review Content: This is an extremely poor product that does not function properly. Sometimes it works, mostly it doesn't. It can rarely find the  home page and seems to default to Netflix or BBC i player. It was purchased  specifically  for catch up tv and fails miserably. To make things worse a message appears advising to contact Amazon Customer Services. If anyone can tell me how to achieve this I would be grateful. Having submitted  the above review Amazon made contact. The product was returned to factory settings, all apps were lost and had to be reinstated ( which took an hour ) and everything worked for 24 hours.  Amazon said they would ring back in 3 days to check progress, but that didn't happen.  I am now back where I started with a useless product. This is amongst the worst items I have ever purchased anywhere.  Do not purchase this product under any circumstances.

Name: P. Bennett
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 December 2020
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: Ray Blureview
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 December 2020
Review Content: Although I have smart access on my devices none supported Disney Plus which is why I bought this device.  The overall quality and ease of use make this a stunning addition to anyone's media setup.  The picture quality is exceptional plugged into my surround amplifier and projected onto a large screen.  The voice control works faultlessly.  I have no hesitation in reccomending this product.

Name: mjc123
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2021
Review Content: Easy to install and use. The voice recognition is good I don't know what Alexa integration is.As always I struggled to put the batteries into the controller. I usually ask one of my son's to do this, I managed by putting on a pair of rubber gloves. If you get stuck this works.The picture quality is very good I am very happy with it. I would buy again and I would recommend it.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2021
Review Content: Before I purchased this I asked the question does it have Apple TV as that was the main reason for purchase and two people said no and 2 said yes ....so I took the gamble !!!Let me assure all those wanting to know the same question that it definitely DOES have Apple TV as you can see from my picture and also NOW TVIt’s easy to use and was delivered quickly and works with my Alexa too!!

Name: Dr R.
Review Title: Overall improvement over the 1st generation, but Dolby Digital passthrough needs to be fixed
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2021
Review Content: I bought this as a replacement for a 1st generation Fire TV Stick, which had become progressively slower over time. The new version is much quicker than the old one and generally performs very well. Setup is quick and simple and the new interface is intuitive.On the down-side. Dolby Digital passthrough simply doesn't work. The option is available, but all that comes through is standard PCM stereo. This is something of a disappointment, seeing as the first generation stick managed this without a problem. I suspect this is a software problem, since the option is available to be selected; it just doesn't do anything. I've tried talking to Amazon customer service, who took me through all of the obvious stuff, to no avail. I've asked for it to be raised with the developers, but I've no idea if this has been taken forward or not. I've seen several others with this issue as well, so it's not an isolated case.So, overall it's a good device, and if 5.1 Dolby Digital isn't an issue for you, go right ahead, otherwise you might want to wait or look elsewhere.

Name: ken
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 February 2021
Review Content: Bought this as our old Firestick was really slow and clunky, not being sure whether it was our broadband that was the problem (or not) took a chance and bought this updated version. It works a treat. Usual easy set up and bingo fast connection , no buffering etc. Haven't bothered with the Alexa connection or voice activation just pleased to have a solid service. Don't hesitate, buy it !!

Name: Binky
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 February 2021
Review Content: Good but has a glitch most days. Sometime it freezes (just a case of taking the batteries out of the remote and putting them back in).IPlayer seems to buffer more than the IPlayer app on my Smart TV and I’ve noticed that on some channel 4 on demand programs it goes to a commercial break abd then back to the beginning of the program. Again, not a problem I’ve had with  my smart TV.I am pleased I bought it despite the glitches.

Name: Daniel Leeman
Review Title: Firestick provides an excellent expandable portal.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 January 2021
Review Content: The Firestick was a Christmas present to provide improved streaming to my projector which it certainly does. I can access Programmes either through the remote or our home Alexa echo. Picture and sound quality are excellent. I’ve recently been using it on our TV and, like a number of people, have noticed that it can interfere with terrestrial reception.
